name: Cathedral of Saint Helena
address: 530 N Ewing St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Awesome! Amazing that a church of this magnitude was built in rustic Montana in the early 1900's. Stunning stained glass with a notable origin.  Take the tour when it's offered to best experience it. Great place to sit and pray.
Very beautiful! No timings online and when we went the doors were locked and no one was around. We really wanted to see the inside.
This is the most gorgeous cathedral! Definitely worth a visit regardless of your faith!

It was breathtaking to walk inside and see this place.  You can see it towering above the town from almost anywhere in town.  It's great that the let anybody walk in and see it.  There is art and decoration on every square inch of the outside and inside of the building.
Beautiful Mass and beautiful architecture. A wonderful and welcoming place to worship.

name: Great Northern Carousel
address: 989 Carousel Way, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great Northern Carousel is a fantastic place to bring children and enjoy some of the local ice cream flavors.  The local flavor is huckleberry, seldom seen anywhere else, and they have all the classic favorites, too.  The carousel is in doors and can be enjoyed regardless of changing weather.  There are seats for 40 riders, with various fantastic real and mythical animals, all artfully rendered, as well as a teacup style spinning seat for four and a loveseat.  There is a small gift shop with toys, stuffed animals, and stylized t-shirts to keep as mementos of your visit.  Tokens for the carousel are $2 each, but you receive an extra 20% on purchases of $20 or more.

This is such a good place to stop as a family. The employees have always been friendly, the ice cream is Montana made and delicious, and the carousel is a blast for the kids. Rides are $2 a go for all ages and there are plenty of fun characters to choose from.
Totally fun place to be! I used to bring my son here for ice cream and carousel rides when he was little. We both rode the carousel and had a blast!

So fun!  Even to ride the carousel as an adult and get scoop icecream.  There was an outdoor large musical instruments to keep kids busy.  While I was there, a dog training business was having a session in the grass area.  So fun to watch all the different breeds of doggies running around while we had our icecream.

It's a great place for kids and adults to have fun with their kids. Riding on the carousel is only $2, they except cash, debit or credit card and with cash you need exact change. It's free for a baby I believe up to 3 yrs to go on but they need to have an adult with them that does have to pay for themselves. They have icecream and soda there and a lot of room. There is also a nice long walking area with eateries and instruments you can play out side. There are right next to the Exploration Works which is a cool science building all ages can go through, haven't been there yet but I'm going. It's a good time for kiddos there.

name: ExplorationWorks
address: 995 Carousel Way, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
This is an awesome children's museum in the heart of Helena.  We stayed at the Best Western right next to this and the famous carousel and suffice to say it was a huge success.  This place has lots of random cool educational things for kids to do.

Some of my favorites were the water features including a tsunami simulator and trying to build buildings that could withstand the force of a tsunami (spoiler alert, many things don't and can't and that's the point).  They have the same concept for earthquakes as well which is just as interesting.

Upstairs they have a more relaxed playing area but it includes a funny feature where you put bands on your head and your brain waves move a ping pong ball type object.  I can't tell how this works or if it's staged, but it cracked me up watching my kids try to "out think" each other to move the ball to the other person's goal.

Affordable and accessible other than some parking issues.  Highly recommend coming here if you're in the Helena area or even just travelling nearby like us.
A nice stop.  Better for younger kids, under 12.  Could keep kids entertained for an hour or 2.  Pass is good for the day, so you can come back.
Just awesome.  Fun for all ages (adults included!). Always interesting, and so much fun that it's the reward my kids pick after a good week of school.
A wonderful educational experience!!! Great hands on learning! Bring coins for the tornado machine.  Kids love it.  Carousel and ice cream next door.

Nice place for kids who like to play and explore. Not a super “scientific” place but a nice, quiet and fun place for kids to free play. And free wifi for parents ;) We have a pass to a science centre from Alberta and they accept those for admission.

name: Reeder's Alley
address: 212 S Park Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Really cool historical area. Reeder's Alley is situated in the southwest corner of downtown Helena, the capitol of Montana.  It is the oldest intact piece of early Helena. The property is a strong link to the beginnings of a settlement here, offering insights into the lives of miners, the Chinese influence, building techniques of the time, and life of the common men and women who came here seeking their fortune.

It's Sunday so a lot of it's closed but very pretty and is a nice walk up and down the alley. I believe there's a restaurant that you could also eat at. All in all, it's a very nice place to visit and walk around
Quaint corner of the town that seems lost in time.
Fun look into the past.  Enjoyed the buildings and brick street.  Quick stop on the edge of Helena.
Wow, what a beautiful part of the downtown helena area. It's no wonder it's a popular place for portraits. My personal favorite location for a relaxing evening walk.

name: Holter Museum of Art
address: 12 E Lawrence St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Good museum with great art and variety of pieces. I love that they sell local art in the gift shop! Fun classes for kids AND adults!!! The paint and sip helped me rekindle my love of painting! Stellar teachers to boot! ;)
Wonderful! Small space but well worth a visit. I loved the current exhibits. Highly recommend this place & wish I could see their next exhibit but I'm just passing through town.

I love this museum. Normally i don't like museums very much, but since the end of last year I've come here almost every week, normally twice a week. It supports teens such as myself very well, and is very all inclusive to all groups
Small but mighty art gallery. Brilliant installation by Catherine Weldon currently, great artwork by women from Peru, live demo of loom work and wool spinning. Lots to see, buy and treasure!

Richard Swanson's "Red Shift Rocker" is a public art installation at the Holter Museum of Art in Helena, Montana.  The piece is quite lively and animated and reminds me of a rooster's comb!  The gallery handles work by many diverse and talented artists and has something to fit most everyone's budget.  Definitely worth a visit!

name: Spring Meadow Lake State Park
address: 2715 Country Club Ave, Helena, MT 59620, USA
reviews: Great place to take the family out for the day and even get some fishing in. Located right in the heart of Helena, it is not out of the way at all and certainly worth a trip even just to hang out for lunch. The view is really nice especially for being right in town that you would never even know.
State Fish & Game rehabs birds and animals near this site. God bless them!
Such a great local treasure Helena has to share with people
A beautiful Spring-like day to go for a walk. Did 2 laps to listen to birds sing and see the geese stand on the ice. A perfect afternoon.

Spring Meadow Lake State Park is the crown jewel among all the local parks. It is close to town, so people who can't go too far afield on their own (kids, for instance) can get there on foot or by bicycle.  
   The lake itself is also a gem - it is usually clear and it is always deep, cold, spring-fed and full of fish that everybody and anybody can try to catch.
   Helena is blessed with abundant parks and lots of nearby venues for outdoor fun, but compared to any other urban parks and fishing spots anywhere, Helena's  Spring Meadow Lake State Park cannot be beat.

name: Original Governor's Mansion
address: 304 N Ewing St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Gorgeous craftsmanship and immaculately preserved and restored rooms and objects from another age, presented by lovely and knowledgable people.  The green leather paneling and detailed woodwork in the dining room alone is worth the visit.

We had a wonderful tour of the governor's mansion in helena.  Anthony was a great tour guide and we learned a great deal about the history of the mansion and the early history of Helena.  If you have an hour and like old buildings, this is well worth your time

Unfortunately we weren't able to go inside but we walked all around the grounds.  It's a very cool building and I'm glad that it is still around as a museum.  There's an entry fee and limited hours for a tour.
We had a great tour and my granddaughter enjoyed doing the scavenger hunt. Tour guides were very knowledgeable!! Fun afternoon and hour tour
Nice slice of history. Easy to pick out some non period specific restoration items though. Glad its here and the tour is very nice.

name: Last Chance Tours
address: 225 N Roberts St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
Went with the family. We had a great time. The kids enjoyed the ride while the wife and I were entertained by the tour itself.
Lots of interesting history in the capital city of Montana. Things I've never heard of about the city I was born in. So even if you love in Helena it's worth a ride.
The tour is about an hour long and the driver was very knowledgeable, there was always something to look at and hear about.
Great little tour a d history of Helena! I believe the train leaves hourly. Wear a coat if it's a cool or wear day because you might get wet.
My girlfriend and I rode the tour train on our anniversary, and it was a hit! Short (1 hour) and sweet. The conductor was friendly and entertaining. I would recommend it :)
Our students took the Trolley from Helena College to Carroll College for the Montana College Fairs. The students had a great time! Awesome and affordable experience.

name: Visit Helena Montana
address: 105 Reeders Alley, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Our home town and Capitol of Montana  many attractions and things to do live theater excellent places to eat  play  socializing  good schools Carroll College  junior college
Karen was very helpful and personable glad we stopped in!
Staff was knowledgeable and able to recommend a number of good hikes. Wish they were able to provide maps of mount Helena trails for free
The most awsome town ever. Next to my hometown Its the best
Very friendly staff.

name: Memorial Park
address: 1203 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great park. Wonderful grassy area to enjoy on a sunny day. Wooden playground. I really like how large it is but it is getting worn down. Several spots a board is gone or weak so need to watch the littlest ones extra careful.

It's a really nice park, lots of places to sit around and talk with my friends. There's a really nice playground for kids to hang out in, and the lawn is really well taken care of. There's also a really nice stage, which I'm sure is great for events. Wonderful park, I suggest you go there and have a picnic or something.

Fun and spacious park with lots of playground equipment and swimming pool and water slide. Great place for picnics as well. I used to bring my son here alot when he was little. Great memories with him here.

I really like visiting memorial park, especially in the summer when they have the band that plays. The only thing that I’m a little unsure of is when I take my children to the kids park and there are people sleeping inside of the slides.
The park itself is a great spot for a fun family picnic or group get together, and the kids playground has one entrance and one main exit (unless you count jumping over the fence)
Great playground for bigger kids as well as for the small toddlers

name: Montana Wild - FWP
address: 2668 Broadwater Ave, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Our daughter wanted to go on her birthday. She had been there before, we had not. Although not a huge venue it was EXCELLENT!  A fun place! I learned a lot. Really enjoyed all the "stuffed" animals. Also enjoyed the live fish aquariums.  Definitely a place to take your kids or grandkids. Just off of the Hiway on the west side of town... would make a great place to stop if on a rode trip and just want to stretch and give the kids something interesting to see and do.  If you wanted to go for a walk it also connects to the trail around Spring Meadow Lake, the new 10 Mile Creek park and trails and the trail (Centennial?) back to Carroll College, Centennial Park, Memorial Park, the Great Northern Town Center.  Would also be a good destination for a family bike ride from almost anywhere in Helena.
Went there for a field trip with kids I work with and they loved it, definitely taking my son there soon.
Amazing opportunity to learn about native wildlife! Very fun place to visit!
Great place to learn about Montana’s wildlife. Good for out of state guests with children.
Beautiful,  great wild life information about montana!

name: Centennial Park
address: 1200 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great playground, lots of places to ride your bike, pump track is small but fun for the whole family!

Lovely park. Quite large including a flat area to kick or throw a ball around, baseball diamonds, walking & biking trails, skate park, bike park, volleyball courts, dog park, small playground and climbing structure for younger ones. Great place to spend a sunny day!

Fun, little park, great views....next to dog park, entertaining to look at the dogs. My 18month old enjoyed it. Could use some swings for little ones..but Mountains on one side, Carroll College on the other, we'd go back.
Great park. Large sports field and walking paths. Also a bike area, dog park and excellent news playground. One of our favorite playgrounds, unique compared to most.

This park is pretty big considering that it's entirely within the city limits. It features a skate park, many soccer and baseball fields, a dog park (with separate areas for large and small dogs), many picnic tables, a playground, some stationary fitness stations, and some outstanding pedestrian walkways that are connected to trails that go all the way out to Springmeadow Lake State Park (passing Barney Park along the way) in one direction, and to Nature Park in the other. It is also adjacent to Carroll College and the YMCA, and is connected to Memorial park via a pedestrian underpass, making it a top-notch, comprehensive recreation destination. This is a fine city park.

name: Broadwater Hot Springs & Fitness
address: 4920 W, US-12, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: We did swimming on a Thursday afternoon in Feb. taking advantage of toddlers swimming free. Nice pool, only the one big pool/hot pool were open by the restaurant. They are building a new indoor pool and another outside pool areas that were not open. Nice dressing room, clean. Wait service at the pool for people who wanted drinks or food. Plenty of room, with a bench all along the edge. An island in the middle my kids loved walking around.

Great hot springs and amazing food.

I came to visit my family with my girlfriend and they took us here to show off a little. The hot springs were great, and my girlfriend especially had a lot of fun. But the real treat was the food we had after. I couldn't have expected how amazing the good was. I figured it would be decent, like a kitchen added to the side of a main attraction, but the food was sole of the best I've had in a long time. The reuben sandwich i had was actually probably the best one I have ever had.

Good beer selection as well.
Was crowded but still pretty nice. Will definitely try going again when there aren't so many people. The restaurant was amazing! Great food and prices where affordable.

Nice clean dressing/shower rooms. The old pool needs a little TLC but is nice for laps. I will give it 5 stars when their new pools open...which is a mystery but they look ready. If you are of age try the Bloody Caesar with sake.

Well, first, having multiple pool temps is way cool. You can soak & relax in warmer stuff, you can swim & exercise a little in the lukewarm rec pool, and you can get that body temp up & then cool it down with the hot tub & cold plunge. Secondly, picking from the excellent beer selection & some good pub grub in the well appointed bar is a nice way to go after a healing soak & swim cycle or two. And thirdly, and so hugely appreciated, is the Broadwater allowing cancer patients to soak free for a couple of hours on Thursday afternoons! Thank you so much for that Broadwater!!

name: Sleeping Giant Lanes & Mini Golf
address: 3355 Tricia St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great Bowling Alley.  Recently raised prices by quite a bit, which is unfortunate.  Used to eat dinner there weekly and buy beer by the pitcher because it was cheap, but now the prices are a little too high for that.  The bowling however is great, and the staff is awesome!  No longer has mini golf either sadly.

Great bowling alley. Im not sure if he's the owner, but the guy that's at the counter on the weekends is a great guy! The staff are always friendly! I went every other week the 9 months my girlfriend was doing her internship at the hospital. It really was the only thing I enjoyed about helena.

Fun place to take my toddler, pretty average as far as bowling alleys go. Definitely can't eat any of their food being gluten sensitive. But I'm grateful it's here since helena doesn't have a huge selection for kids
Love the new owners. It feels like they care about the place more than the last.
Nice and easy mini golf area and bowling area. Good place to hangout

name: Pioneer Park
address: 120 S Last Chance Gulch St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great park right next to the library. A fully fenced in playground great for the smaller kids age 2-5. This will definitely be our favorite place on sunny days with all of the shade trees.
We came in time for "five alive", loved the food trucks, the kids activities, and what an energy, you people of Helena! Looks like a fun town to live in.
Went to live at 5. It was great fun
This park is beautiful— Alive @ 5 on summer Wednesday’s are very chill and relaxing.
A nice park with a place for smaller children to play with an enclosed playground

name: Last Chance Splash Waterpark & Pool
address: 1203 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great looking pool. Haven't actually been inside yet but looks clean and the lifeguards always seem to be paying attention.
Had a great time. We were there for a swim meet. There's lots of space available in the park for the spectators. They also have a nice playground for the kids to play on.
My kiddos always have fun here. They love to swim and goof around at the splash park. They've taken swim lessons the last few summers as well, and the instructors are always helpful and patient.
My kids love going here admission is cheap and we always have lots of fun.
Awesome park, friendly staff clean and good location

name: Thomas Francis Meagher Statue
address: Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: A very interesting spot full of history. You could spend the day discovering, picnicking, and checking out the visitor center. The particular day I met my family there, it was VERY HOT and there were dogs involved so we didn't last long in the heat. I would definitely go back when the summer heat has cooled. It was intriguing to see the battlefield, trails walked by soldiers, and the trees were so big and beautiful!
A must visit if you're in the area and are a student of Irish history.

The man who made the Irish Tri-Color flag, fought in our Civil War and became a legislator way out west. A real American hero, and an Irish legend to boot! I am proud to see this here, and hope in the future to help preserve Thomas' history!
Statue of the first governor of the Montana Territory.  Interesting history/: Sounds that like most Irishmen Tommy not only had good leadership skills he had the gift of gab.
Drive out and see it.

name: Black Sandy State Park
address: 6563 Hauser Dam Rd, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Went overnight for tent camping. Nice spot right next to the water. There are 6 tent spots, none of which are bad. RV pads look nice right next to the water.
Great site, beautiful area.  Minus 1 star for super small camp sites, but they don't have much land to work with. We will be back for sure
The first few spots are really nice, grass and on the lake. Spots down further are congested with the fire pit and table on the opposite side from where you exit the camper. The hornets are horrible.
Very nice areas, usually less crowded than Canyon Ferry. Make sure you stock up before you go, there aren't any stores close by. Some nice hikes and chances to see some wildlife.
This is an excellent location for outdoor recreation. Plus, the staff are super friendly and the facilities are always maintained; very clean!

name: The Montana Blue Jewel Mine
address: 5582 Four Cee's Rd, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: A1 experience. Did Philipsburg earlier this week and had fun but this place was way better. You get to see the whole mining process as well as participating on a small scale in your own mining experience digging your own dirt, seiving it as well as picking out stones. The genuine experience. Sapphires n garnets far larger than we found on Philipsburg. Plus owner Bruce was full of history and stories. Well worth the money.
Off the beaten track and lots of sweat equity needed to get your sapphires and absolutely worth it! Beautiful views and good conversation with the boys and other clients.

Our group of nine traveling across the country was looking for something new and exciting to do while near Helena.   Mining for Sapphire sounded like a great opportunity for the kids in the group.  We called the night before for reservations, and woke up early to head to the mine.  Bruce welcomed us and showed everyone the ropes.  Within seconds, the kids were all smiles and enjoyed every second of it.  We had a blast and can not recommend this enough to anyone interested.  Enjoy and dig away...  good luck Bruce!

We had a great time with Bruce, Bob, and Nina! We were shown the ropes for mining with good instruction and patience. Bruce was particularly interactive and we enjoyed listening to his stories and advice. Out family of five had a nice time and came out with some significant stones! Our kids were 10, 13, & 16 for this. A younger boy (6?) with another family needed a hand keeping entertained. My 16 year old enjoyed the final hunt more than the dusty work required to get there.

We didn’t even end up going here, but they put a bad taste in my mouth just from the call. I understand it’s a busy holiday weekend but basic manners still apply. 
Maybe we will give it another chance in the future as they had great reviews, but for now we are going to Spokane Bar Sapphire Mines instead 🤷‍♀️ Next time, be polite even if you’re full for the weekend.

name: Tizer Botanic Garden & Arboretum
address: 38 Tizer Lake Rd, Jefferson City, MT 59638, USA
reviews: This was an unexpected find. My wife loves gardens so, as we travel, we’re always on the hunt. We drove away from Helena about a half hour, then turned off the highway and ended up on a dirt road…. “what are we getting ourselves into”? But even though the entrance looked modest, once we got past the office/shop/store, the place really opened up. The nice lady gave us a great overview of the place, a map with numbers to go by and off we went. Two hours later, we got done! So many hidden curves to explore. And many, many hidden areas with chairs, or a bench, where you can just sit and enjoy the serenity of the gardens. This aspect is so unlike most gardens we’ve gone to. This is really more of an interactive experience. A creek flows right through the gardens, adding to its charm and makes the flowers have sound too. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and takes a lot of time to answer questions. Really worth the entrance fee.
If you like to photograph plants, this is the place to be! A wide variety of sculptures, furniture, and knick-knacks add character to the gardens.
Very beautiful and eccentric! Didn't get to see it when everything was in bloom but still worth it. A must place to see and visit
stumbled on this amazing garden by chance, absolutely loved it. Great place for a picnic and has a nice retail nursery so you can pick up a living souvenir
What a wonder place to stroll through and rest from travelling.  Peaceful and serene.  We hated to leave.

name: Great Divide Ski Area
address: 7385 Belmont Dr, Marysville, MT 59640, USA
reviews: I knew this guy in high school - he was a senior, I was a sophomore - he was one of the cool kids. Not cool in the slick, my-daddy-bought-me-a-camaro-for-my-birthday kind of cool but, like, down to earth and easy - going cool. For instance, once, in the middle of winter, he showed up wearing gym shorts - the cute shorty ones from the 80s (because it was the 80s), cowboy boots, a pink polo shirt with the collar popped, and a straw cowboy hat - like it was a Tuesday. Great Divide is like that. Also, Betsy is particularly great - super helpful and kind. We love it here.

I came here from Colorado to do work related training and wow I have to say this place is a gem, amazing! no crazy lines, people and staff are friendly and their hospitality is by far the best. This place has a small town feel and the staff and regulars will make you feel at home. Like I said I'm from Colorado and have been to places like Vail, Keystone, and Breckenridge, but this place I can see my self coming back to Montana just for this Ski Area and the vibe and all around atmosphere it provides!
Fun local mountain. Definitely worth the small amount of money to ski here. If there is a lot of snow then you will have an amazing time. When snow is lite it is still a fun place.
Great ski area. Nice bar to have a drink. Changing table in the restroom.

The drive in is simple, no traffic at all. Staff were incredibly friendly. I didn’t wait even once in the 2.5 hours I was there to get on a lift. Lifts seem a little outdated, but move fairly quick, much faster than the explorer lift at Big Sky, yet smaller. Seems to have a wide variety of terrain to ride. I’m looking forward to getting into those trees once they get just a bit more snow.

name: Grandstreet Theatre
address: 325 N Park Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: A nice variety of plays to choose from, a relaxing experience, and quality acting from the performers!
I love that Helena has great community theatre! Reasonable prices for high-quality local productions. It's great fun whether you are in the audience or the cast!
I go to Grsndstreet and it is like my second home. Thank you Grsndstreet! Love, Quincey

I am never disappointed by the shows Grandstreet puts on. They have top notch designers, strong actors, and one of the best programs for children I've ever encountered. This theatre rivals some of the best urban regional theatres in the US.
Great staff and volunteers. Nice variety of productions. Super theater school.

name: Gates of the Mountains
address: 8320 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: The boat ride was a perfect way to see some beautiful Montana backcountry you couldn't otherwise see.
Pretty good spot to drop by and fishing, but other than that, you might be disappointed. Lack of parking space
Beautiful 2 hour boat excursion on the Missouri River in a canyon with a great narrative relating history and nature.
The river boat guide was very informative and knowledgable, as well as humorous & entertaining.  We really enjoyed the cruise in the open boat.
Inexpensive, pleasant boat ride, OK for history buffs following Lewis & Clark trail, entertaining guide though he is retiring. Not much wild life, a very distant eagle, some osprey, and a dear.

name: Pediatric Dentistry
address: 3116 Saddle Dr #1, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: We have been to multiple pediatric dentists in a variety of states. Dr. Nate, Dr. Kevin and Dr. Rich and their staff are the best we've ever experienced. They are knowledgeable and wonderful with children. Their staff is always friendly and are experts in being flexible and creative with children who need different modalities of care. Our daughter has special needs and they are consistently fantastic with her. We are so grateful to have them here in Great Falls.

A great practice and overall experience for me and my 2-year-old daughter. She first saw Ember who was knowledgeable, fun and patient when my daughter was hesitant to get in the dentist chair. Dr. Kevin was warm, a good listener and summarized some key things we can do to keep her mouth and teeth clean. Very pleased with our visit- thank you!

I took all 4 of my children in for a dental check-up at the same time. I was a little nervous about handling all of my kiddos at one time but it turned out to be a wonderful experience. My kids really enjoyed all of the decor and the live fish tanks! Everyone was very understanding of my children and their nerves and helped them feel comfortable. Having moved to Helena from Portland, OR, I left wondering why the big city didn't have any medical or dental office nearly as cool for children.

There was a little mixup with our appointment time but the ladies at the front desk made sure they got us right in!  We met Dr. Richie for the first time and what another GREAT doctor.  The whole staff is just wonderful!  Thank you to you all for making every experience at the office terrific.

Helena is so lucky to have two amazing Pediatric Dentists locally in our community. The front staff are very welcoming and warm. The dental assistants are always professional and really create a WOW experience for every child that enters the dental clinic. I highly recommend Pediatric Dentistry for the whole state of Montana.

name: Nature Park
address: 2250 Gold Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Close to home with a nice paved walking trail. (Another unpaved trail on the west edge along Bill Roberts Golf Course.) The paved trail connects or continues along the south side of the golf course and ends close to the trail to Spring Meadow Lake and the new Ten Mile Creek park.. that stretches all the way to Fort Harrison.
Awesome place to take a stroll with the kids
It's relaxing is beautiful and it just makes you feel like you're in the woods
It's a fun and quick walk with the family.
This a beautiful easy paced walk!

name: Memorial Park Warming House & Ice Rink
address: 5 Memorial Dr, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: This place is awesome it’s super cheap and fun for both people who are learning how to ice skate and for people who already know how to ice skate great place highly suggest it!
It is a fun place to go if your bored cause there is nothing to do in helena. The ice could be better tho...
It is a great place to learn how to ice sk8

Over the many years not much has changed with this place. It's a Helena Hometown favorite in the winter time with the ice skaters. Nothing too exciting to see here. Whether you're learning to skate or an expert skater it's a great place to go in the winter time for outdoor skating. You never know what you're going to get with the conditions of the ice. It's usually the best mid-season and as spring gets closer conditions begin to degrade.
Purrrfect place

name: Montana Preservation Alliance
address: 44 W 6th Ave #110, Helena, MT 59601, USA

name: Lewis & Clark Caverns State Park
address: 25 Lewis & Clark Caverns Road, Whitehall, MT 59759, USA
reviews: The caverns are amazing and the tours are fantastic. I have been through several times over the years and always loved the experience. The candlelight tours in the winter are amazing for the experience and historic aspects, but the summer tours really show off the caverns with the lights. All of the guides are passionate about their jobs and the caves, and love to teach. Great place to visit and bring friends and family.

This was a great experience. At the time our kids were 5 years old and 8 years old (almost 6 and 9). They did okay getting through the tour but it is a pretty good hike. I don't think I would bring kids any younger then that unless you are prepared to carry them for part of the stroll outside the caves.

It was hot outside the cave and cool inside so make sure you pack water and a hoodie or warm clothing. Small snack would not hurt either.

A good hike and interesting tour. Long eared bat's seemed to like us. If you are affraid of small tight areas or cannot hike about 2-3 miles you might not be tough enough!  It is an old school hike that is fairly easy downward caverns tour with MT history lesson. Definitely a unique spot that keeps the kids off the phone!

These Caverns are a jewel.   The drive to the caverns winds along the Jefferson River,  with cliffs adorning the sides of the road.   Our party were excited to to the Caverns today, as it was the rare tour through the cave system with candles!!!  This Candlelight tour is offered only at Christmas.   What a treat!!  The vision of the fellow participants weaving among the cave features is idyllic.   It is surprising how much light the candlelight can make in the total dark.   This is a best kept secret.  The tour guides are top notch.
A truly fascinating and unique experience! Amazing formations of nature. A true treasure. Outstanding tour and educational experience. Highly recommend!

name: Grant-Kohrs Ranch National Historic Site
address: 266 Warren Ln, Deer Lodge, MT 59722, USA
reviews: This place was pretty amazing!! We went to get our National Parks Passport book stamped but it turned out to be pretty spectacular!!! There was a working blacksmith shop and a real cowboy with coffee brewing over an open fire! LOTS of buildings to self guide through. Cows and horses and chicken. We went out of our way to go so we didn't have time for the tour of the house but wish we had! The views were amazing as well. The husband and wife team that we met at the visitors center were so nice and super helpful. They volunteer their time to work there! We were both super impressed!!!!

If you are anywhere near this park, do not miss out on the only operational ranch in the National Parks registry. This is one of the best kept secrets of our NP system. The park is a working ranch still. The family that ran and operated this ranch very carefully kept all the records, details and many of the artifacts from the past. There are very few reproductions in the main ranch home and the cowboy housing which is awesome. You get to see how life was for the cowboys back in the 1800s.

Awesome experience and very informative. Park ranger at the entrance taught me and my kids all about bison and how they were used in the 1800s. Tons of stuff to look at, recomend taking the horse drawn carriage around the farm and then enjoying some cowboy coffee made over a fire by a cowboy.

Amazing. I learned a lot about US History. You must visit the main house. Wait for the tour. Most important part of the tour. They are not allowed to take a pic inside of house.

My private tour guide (Dan Shook) was amazing. He explained everything very clear.
Very nice place. Worth a visit. There are scheduled events that you might wanna check before you go.

name: Montana Historical Society
address: 225 N Roberts St, Helena, MT 59620, USA
reviews: Really neat little museum. Also, the gift shop has some jewelry that is very specific to Helena and so e semi-precious stones that are specific to Montana. I couldnt find any of these stones at the other gift shops in this area. Also, excellent customer service at the gift shop.
what a great museum with tons of Montana history. The CM Russell artwork display is worth goin to see in itself! this is a must do while in Helena
Great Montana history and depth of knowledge on our great state.
Nice meusem with kid friendly exhibits
Love this place! Great places to go to learn about Montana History!

name: Old Montana Prison Museum
address: 1104 Main St, Deer Lodge, MT 59722, USA
reviews: This is a really cool place for a bit of American History. The prison offers a lot of information on a self paced, self guided tour. Between google, signs  and the map the museum provides, you get all the information you could ask for. You can explore inside the prison as well as the prison yard and surrounding buildings. This is a great place to discover some of America's past in regard to the handling and reform of criminals. Overall very interesting place to visit. There is a gift shop and public restrooms. Also attached to the prison by way of the gift shop is an amazing car museum. One stop 2 attractions. The employees are very friendly and helpful. I truly recommend making a stop here if you're in the area.
Loved the experience of being able to go through the old prison. The car museum was just as cool. Great price for a great place.

Great museum! They also have a car museum attached that you can view before it after touring the old prison. It is a self-guided tour, so the ladies at the front desk give you a very informational packet with all the signs listed that you can read aloud to your party as you tour the prison. Nothing spooky happened to use while we toured, but some of our pictures we took do give me the creeps. A fascinating experience for history lovers, and paranormal enthusiasts alike.

This is a great place to visit. Make sure to stop at the store across the street. The People are friendly and the subject matter is fascinating. Just be sure to have enough money to pay to enter, as it is a bit pricey ($10-15). We hope to go back again.

This is an incredible museum in a great little town. If you're out and come across the signs for this museum, stop and check it out. It's well maintained, the staff have great stories and are really friendly. Dropped one star because a good bit of exhibits are "closed for repairs".

name: Helena-Lewis and Clark National Forest
address: Neihart, MT 59465, USA
reviews: Best map system for any mountain range at the ranger stations for free! very diverse area, year round fun, grab a map and it's easy to explore the back country

Beautiful location to camp or hike.  During the November December time frame you can pick up a 5 dollar Christmas tree tag and get a tree.  You can get some great exercise and views while doing any of these activities.

A wild and rustic backcountry hike or backpacking journey can be found here. We back packed for three days and didn't encounter any other hikers even on the CDT. I do not like hiking in pants and my legs paid the price on these often overgrown trails but it was worth it. Don't forget your map and compass - one of the trails simply disappeared so you'll want tools to navigate. Water is fairly plentiful, as are butterflies! The area burned many years back and it's interesting to see how it is recovering.
Trail #497 is a logging road. Pretty well maintained and easy to hike. We didn't get anywhere near the top of the trail, but it was a nice hike.
Great forest. Lots of trails and mountain bike trails .... Glacier Park is amazing.

name: Big Sky Brilliance
address: 2728 Colonial Dr, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Excellent experience working with Dillon and Big Sky Brilliance. He was able to make the exact ring I wanted for a price I could not find anywhere else. He did a great job answering any questions or concerns I had and was very responsive. On top of it all, my ring was delivered very quickly. Highly recommend working with him for your next jewelry purchase!

When I almost gave up on my search for the perfect ring for my then fiance (now my wife) Dillion stepped in and helped me so much! I'm a needy customer and I can be difficult. Dillion patiently found the perfect sapphire and ring for my budget. Thank you so much!

If you’re looking for an easy, unique and fun experience while choosing the perfect piece for your loved one, then Dillon with Big Sky Brilliance is your guy! He takes the time to get to know you and your loved one. This allows him the advantage to understand exactly what you’re looking for. We worked together for a few weeks and designed the most beautiful wedding set for my fiancé and myself. We are so proud of our rings and so happy that we chose Big Sky Brilliance to design such timeless, momentous pieces. Thank you Dillon!

Dillon-
Thank you for making my experience so great! You were very informative and educated me on jewelry in a way I hadn't expected nor valued until working with you. The approach you took in helping find something so special and unique made the experience comfortable and enjoyable. I highly recommend anyone in search of fine jewelry to give Dillon a shout. He will work within your budget, and exceed your expectations, all while being flexible and eager to satisfy your expectations.  The ring arrived on time and was everything and more I had been hoping for. Thank you again Dillon! I will be recommending and using Big Sky Brilliance in the future!

Dillon was very accommodating In meeting with me. His turnaround and ability to provide example renderings limited meetings to work through and bring our ideas together.  He has a wonderful eye for colors, etc. I enjoyed working with him and would definitely work with him again. LOVE my beautiful ring.

name: Gates of the Mountains, Inc.
address: 3131 Gates of the Mountains Rd, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: This river is amazingly beautiful! You won't be able to take your eyes off the scenery! Our guide was very knowledgeable about the history of various sites along the river. I took one star off because the ticket building and the boat are swarmed with mosquitoes! Between the mosquitoes and the bees on the boat, it was enough to take a little enjoyment from the ride. But overall, the boat tour is an impressive experience!

The place that runs the boat tours does a great job.  The boat drivers are informative about the history and events.  The boat ride is slow-going but enjoyable.  The scenery is amazing, and the price for a 2 hour two seem pretty cheap.  Definitely glad we went.

My husband and I had been before and enjoyed it so much, we took my mother.  Very informational, educational and fun!!  Great for all ages!  The ride is smooth, the guides are awesome, and the scenery is beautiful!  We saw several bald eagles this trip.  We will most definitely be back again.  Next year we want to do the bat tour!

Awesome boar tour. Some construction on road with a pilot car taking cars back n forth so had a good 15 min wait once getting into the park. Give yourself time. They ask you to line up 10 mins prior to your tour time. The office is the brown building to the left once you get to the marina and the do have bathrooms downstairs and on board. 
Tour guides were super informative and funny, we saw the gates and lots of Bald eagle, osprey and turkey vultures. They showed us batcaves and told us a lot about the history. Very beautiful and enjoyable. Keep a jacket as it started raining and got cold on the water. 
Psycho insects (nats) were swarming us all, we were all going crazy in line. We thought they were mosquitos but were told they do not bite, they are nats and there are no mosquitos on the marina as the bats eat them all. 
Even thought it was so annoying as they were flying up our noses, they did back off once the boat was in motion and it was nice to know we would not be eaten alive!
Brian was an awesome tour guide.
Gates of the Mountain is a great little stop. Nice guided boat tour up the Missouri River and back down again. Good scenery and some history learned along the way!

name: South Hills Dental
address: 2480 Tracy Dr, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Not many dentists see VA patients but South Hills Dental does and their treatment is greatly appreciated. I drive from Great Falls to Helena to see Dr. Barry and its worth getting up at 5:30 to make it on time. Dr Barry is one of the best dentists I’ve seen in my 52 years. I was married to a dental hygienist for 22 years so I know. Dr Barry and his assistant Nina work great together and very little time is lost getting tools or prepping. Dr Barry knows how to give a shot and make it stick around for a while. Very little to no pain during and after his shots. What makes the difference is that they care about the patient and the work they do for them. I have never been rushed out or pressured to make a decision on work. Everything is explained to me so I know what work is going to be done. The girls up front are friendly and make you feel at ease. If more dental offices were like this one people wouldn't have any anxiety about seeing their dentist. Great Job!!! And be proud of the office you have all made together.

You guys are absolutely fantastic. I have never been to a dentist office that is so caring and so informative and no surprises. Your prices are something that I can afford and today was especially nice. I cannot remember the dentist name but he was so kind and wonderful. The hygienist was very good 
 and also very kind. Again thank you for being so professional but yet so compassionate. It was greatly appreciated.
No wait time!  Professional and personable, made sure I was comfortable at all times and that I understood any concerns they had.  I highly recommend!

This office is WONDERFUL!  They did custom mouth guards (athletic guards) for both of my kids.  The hygienist was super friendly and worked extra hard to make sure the insert wasn't uncomfortable for the kids.  Highly recommend these guys!

Simply the best.  Best, most inclusive exam I've ever had. I've never sat in a dentist chair this long, but I've also never really had it this easy. I was assigned the best tech, she cared and was on top of her game, only surpassed by a great dentist, truly a great team.  It was obvious in the beginning that my plan was designed with care, not only for what I needed at the moment,  but what my mouth needed for the future, and I also saw how he passed on his profession.  I remain impressed, and for my first visit I think I'll stick to my first comment, Simply the best!

name: World Museum of Mining
address: 155 Museum Way, Butte, MT 59701, USA
reviews: We had an excellent tour of the Orphan Girl Mine led by Michael.  The World Museum of Mining focuses on the mining in Butte although there are displays that weren’t used in the Orphan Girl Mine.  The displays in the mine are interesting.  They have an eclectic collection of items on the property-some vintage from the era and town and some from other areas.  Much restoration is still needed on the mines and grounds.  Included in the modest price is admission to the doll house/doll displays and rock display from around the world.  Worth a stop if you’re in the area.
Went here for treat street for Halloween and the kids always get ample candy. The wait is long, but definitely worth it.

Just a fantastic experience! We took the 100 foot mine tour and just loved it! We really enjoyed the talk and learned so much about mining, the history of mining and of Butte. We now have such respect for the men who worked those mines and put their life on the line. Highly recommend this tour

This is a neat place with an awesome underground tour. The guide was a born and raised in Butte and very knowledgeable about the history of the mine. The buildings are all from the old town and you can walk into the church buildings, but only get to observe others from outside. I've read some saying this is a waste of time, but it is not. The history is amazing and you also can walk up one of the head frames which is neat. My respect for the miners only grew as I leaned more and more. The history of Butte is tragic and beautiful at the same time. They had electricity before New York and how advanced they were blows my mind.

Unique place to visit! Not entirely wheelchair accessible. A person using a wheelchair will need a significant amount of help. There is a lot to see and read about. Could easily spend a few hours here reading and learning. Would definitely recommend visiting. I would recommend to the staff to find a way to provide better lighting to the individual "businesses" on display. Very friendly staff! Would enjoy a guided tour next time!

name: Montana State Capitol
address: 1301 E 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Montana State Capitol Building is a beautifully ornate building.  A walk through the State Capitol, through the many corridors, and up the staircases is a walk through the History of the Great State of Montana.  I've selected a few photographs of our visit.  If you find my review helpful, please like it. Thank you!
I recommend driving by at night to snap photos. It’s really peaceful and quiet. You can take a picture at the steps out front fairly easy. Great tourist must do.

So much history in this place. You can go on tours with a guide, or on your own. You can make a visit here be as short or long as you want. It just depends on how much you want to learn. During legislative session it is neat to sit in the gallery on the 4th floor for the House or Senate floor session. If you visit between January-April of even numbered years you may have to park a couple blocks away. This is when session is in, and it’s a packed house.
Great place to visit. Lots of art to enjoy. My toddler loves going up the big staircase and down the elevators. We can see the done from our house and it is always beautifully lit up in the evenings.

The Montana State Capitol is the state capitol of the U.S. state of Montana that houses the Montana State Legislature which is located in the state capital of Helena at 1301 East Sixth Avenue. The building was constructed between 1896 and 1902 with wing-annexes added between 1909 and 1912. A design competition for the building was conducted in 1896. The commission selected a design by George R. Mann as the winner. In 1897, after it was found that the Commission was planning to scam money from the building project, it was disbanded and a second Capitol Commission was convened. The new Commission abandoned Mann's plan as being too costly, and had a second design competition, won by Charles Emlen Bell and John Hackett Kent, of Bell & Kent of Council Bluffs, Iowa. In order to have their design built, Bell & Kent relocated their office to Helena. While Mann's building was never built in Montana, it was selected later as the basic design for the Arkansas State Capitol. The winning design by Bell & Kent had been altered already during the construction phase, when in 1901 the commission asked for the structure to be made more imposing by increasing the height of the dome. Kent opposed the changes, as his original low spherical dome was meant to be "pure Greek", but Bell advocated the commission's request. Between 1909 and 1912, the building was extended by the addition of two new wings on the eastern and western sides. This work was executed by Link & Haire, architects of Butte, with F. M. Andrews & Company of New York as consulting architects.

name: The Myrna Loy
address: 15 N Ewing St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Had such a great experience! Myrna Loy brings super groups from around the world to Helena Montana! I went to see Rio Mira who are a group from Colombia and it made my wife tear up because she is from there. It was so special! Thanks so much!
Great venue near historic downtown Helena, within easy walking distance of many great dinner spots, a perfect place to have a night out. Go check them for an enjoyably intimate evening.
Very fun experience! A must if you're in Helena. Small, intimate movie atmosphere with drinks and food. The popcorn is super cheap compared to a big theater! I will be coming back OFTEN!
Lots of fun. Old theater, excellent venue for the eclectic events held here
Love the independent films here. It is such a sweet place

name: The Sewing Palace
address: 124 E Lyndale Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Friendly, welcoming staff.  Always willing to help.  They have a great selection for all your sewing needs even those new  things  you didn't know you "needed" until you see them nicely displayed.  Great place to shop.

I love the ladies at the sewing palace. They've always been so helpful and willing to take the time needed when I was a beginner. I bought a sewing machine for a present, before I was even there they had it wrapped and ready to go! Thanks Ladies you guys are awesome!
I went into this store yesterday and had a very genuine greeting and was welcomed into the family!! I felt positive and excited to sew my day away!! Sew, I will return!!

I recently made a baby quilt with Jenny's 1 on 1 help. I highly recommend anyone that needs some individual help to work with her. She is very helpful and gives great tips. Cant wait to start our next project together!
The fabrics are wonderful and these ladies know what you need. Awesome.

name: Our Lady of the Rockies
address: 5970 Montana 2, Butte, MT 59701, USA
reviews: The diesel bus trip up the mountain on a 7-mile dirt road that is very narrow, curvey and bumpy was not fun for me.  I tried to look only at hubby & phone and not down the steep hillsides.  However, Mark is an excellent driver!  Dress warm as you reach @8500 feet elevation.  Despite poor weather, the 90-foot statute is worth the view inside the base & out.  Wonderful community effort and preserved history:)

Nice view of Butte, the ride is rough and an hour up and an hour down. You're given 30 minutes, which isn't enough to get photos and really take everything in. Especially if you have small children. This would be great for a picnic for the afternoon, given you ever had time.

What a neat place! I had heard of "our Lady of the Rockies," but I never knew what it was. It was incredible.  No matter your religion you can appreciate this site. Just like I appreciate the Buddha on top of a Mountain in Thailand. Just beautiful and spiritual.
Heads up the only way to get there in winter in by snow mobile. The road is unplowed and there was a good two feet on the road in February. Would recommend for summer!

It was neat to see but not something of great interest to me. I understand it has a lot of history so if that is something that intrigues you for sure check it out! We are not Catholic but my wife liked the idea that it was built to honor women everywhere.

name: Copper King Mansion
address: 219 W Granite St, Butte, MT 59701, USA
reviews: Great historic hotel. Really enjoyed our stay. Meals wo delicious! The tour was fantastic. Beautiful old mansion in the heart of town

I only loved this place because I was intoxicated and could make fun of why people make fun of things. The best thing about it was the person giving the tour made jokes along mine. Honestly,  it's a great piece of history. It's worth it's weight of cost. I say... see it.

We drove by to see the Mansion. We had originally heard the tours were free but found out they were $10/adult and only at specific times. I'm assuming the tours were great, but we didn't get to go on any. The outside alone is very cool to look at and worth the drive by.
great place to have a meet and greet with state legislator Debra Lamm who is running for congress for Montana Very hospitable beautiful environment for such an event.

We are from Salt Lake and took the noon tour today Sept 2nd.  This mansion is amazing with such history.  Our tour guide was Zach and he was awesome, highly  intelligent,  fun and a great sense  of humor.  The history of William Clark is fascinating  and to this day the mansion has retained  its authenticity.   The people are so friendly I highly recommend that you tour this historic place.   Ask for Zach.

name: Sole Sisters
address: 327 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Awesome customer service!  From work to play, clothing for every body. Plus shoes that you won't find anywhere else in town.

A fun and friendly environment. They will learn your name and give you undivided attention and exceptional  customer service. They have things in a wide variety of price ranges. Always great quality and they take card or cash. They also do wrapping during Christmas.
Always so many wonderful choices and the staff is very friendly and helpful!
Best service and spectacular selection of everything needed for the spot-on wardrobe.   My favorite boutique.
Very cute store. They have a great selection in a range of prices.

name: Comfort Suites Airport
address: 3180 Washington St, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Heating/air conditioning unit was VERY noisy when it came on waking us several times during the night. Otherwise our stay was great. Have stayed here several times in the last few years. The renovations look great.

Been content with comfort inns over the years. This last stay was unusually unpleasant.
The young lady at the desk was polite and friendly as she explained that my credit card wouldn't work. I insisted she try again as that didn't make sense. Same result. (Kind of embarrassing) .  We used my wife's card (same account). No problem.  I immediately called my credit card company who explained to me that the reason for the decline was that the person entering the request was inputting the wrong expiration date.

Also the heater in the room has a noisy vibration every time it turned on. Made for a long night. We should have asked for a room change. We politely reported the problem to the receptionist as we were leaving. She would have it repaired but didn't seemed too concerned for our sleepless night.

We had spent the previous two nights at a comfort Inn in billings, mt. Nice place/people except that it kept running out of hot water.
Friendly staff and nice rooms. Gas station/convenience store across the parking lot. Literally 5 minutes from Helena airport. Not over priced.
Free shuttle service was appreciated. Room was clean and spacious!  Staff was friendly. Will return!
Great hotel. I can't wait to stay again after the remodel is complete.

name: Missouri Headwaters State Park
address: 1585 Trident Rd, Three Forks, MT 59752, USA
reviews:
Excellent place to stop while driving up or down I-90.  Great place to stretch legs and see some history. It's really a gem of an experience knowing you are standing at the confluence of the biggest river in the USA and all of the history that goes with it.

 The pay station was unattended.  There is an outhouse bathroom by the pay station.   Recommend walking the mowed trail that goes by the old hotel. .  Kids enjoyed the park. We stayed about one hour total.

This is a really nice state park in Montana. It is where three rivers come together, forming the Missouri River. One especially nice thing about this park, is that all around the headwaters, there are small rocky "mountains" that are really fun to climb. If you climb up one, you get splendid views of the river, the trails, roads, and of the surrounding "mountains" (hills). It's a great place to hike around, have a picnic, or just enjoy the weather.

There is something magical and sacred about the three major rivers coming together to form  the longest river in North America. There are various short but very interesting trails to hike. If you are a bird watcher its a treasure and a must see. The confluence of the Madison and Jefferson is great enough but then you have the Gallatin river joining the other 2 rivers only 1 mile further downstream. There are restrooms, picnic areas and benches placed around the park. There is even a small cave with a couple of  pictographs in it, that is well marked.

We enjoyed a one-night stay here while heading from Yellowstone to Glacier National Park. It is conveniently located near I-90 and was an easy late-in-the-day drive from West Yellowstone via US Hwy 191. We knew we would be arriving there late on a Saturday, so we made a reservation a few months in advance. We were glad we did, as it was pretty full. The campground has nice, had flat sites, running water and pit toilets, which were as clean as a pit toilet can be in the summer time. Be sure to walk around and check out the informative displays about the history in this location. Very interesting.

We were brought here by our local friends, and totally surprised by this beautiful park.  As the “Head” of the longest river in the US, this park definitely left a clear and long lasting memory for my self, and gave me a good story to tell about the great state of Montana!

name: Best Western Premier Helena Great Northern Hotel
address: 835 Great Northern Blvd, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: A nice quaint hotel with a welcoming lobby and staff.  The hotel parking for guests is not attached to the hotel and is slightly a bit out of the way. My main concern is having guest vehicles out of view from the hotel which could be a target of vandals and thieves.
We always stay at this hotel in Helena.  It is very clean and has great staff.  The handicap rooms are very accessible.  The walk-in shower is most appreciated.

They have always been good to me when I book here and when I'm in town for meetings and conference.  Only reason why I had 4 stars, is due to the swimming pool not being available.  (Remodel - hopefully there will be some cool lighting hint hint).

Awesome hotel!
Close to Carroll College.
The rooms are big and very clean the hand written message from housekeeping  welcoming you is a nice touch.
The breakfast was very good. 
The staff is very professional.
We will stay there again.

Attending a conference. Accommodations suitable for purpose. The individual lunches provided were in plastic containers with no flatware nor condiments provided. Some participants had to wait for food as not enough meals were not provided.

name: C. M. Russell Museum
address: 400 13th St N, Great Falls, MT 59401, USA
reviews: I thought this was just going to an art museum but it's so much more!  I love the Russell home with it's character and antiques. I loved the Cabin Studio and imagine watching him paint there or coming to check on him and finding him sleeping on the cot. And the museum with it's variety: Western Art, displays on Western life, so much info on bisons, native American items, saddles, hats and a hearse!  The museum store is also pretty awesome. They have nice gift items.

Wonderful, beautiful and breathtaking paintings by Charles Russell. This is a wonderful museum with much to see along with other artists. This is my third year visiting from Canada and love it every time. Not to miss.

Life is Good! :)

We had a team building experience here for work and got a guided tour.  It was very educational and fun!  I plan to go back on my own in the near future and explore some more.  Definitely give yourself plenty of time, there is a lot to see!  Great for all ages!!

Wonderful place to visit. The exhibits were excellent. The staff was great and helpful. I’d always been an admirer of his works I was so happy to finally visit the museum. 

It was easy to find. Parking was ample and the cost was reasonable. I want to go back again. Take more time.
Great place to visit in Great Falls. The museum was much larger than I expected. Don’t forget to go downstairs and that you can open the drawers!

name: Giant Springs State Park
address: 4803 Giant Springs Rd, Great Falls, MT 59405, USA
reviews: Turned out to be a great Sunday to visit the park. Sun was shining, no wind, 38 degrees out but it felt great. Picnickers we're about. Nice "museum" for the hatchery. Got to feed some really big rainbow trout.

This is by far the best park in great falls and has a lot of good history posted around the park. There is a very clear natural spring, a playground for the kids, lots of barbecues and picnic areas. Just don't leave a mess like some of the tourists do.. throw your trash away and keep this place looking nice.
Absolutley beautiful place top visit. Especially during spring and summer time. Trail access is easy from here and is a must see for anyone paying through or visiting
This trail is absolutely stunning and well maintained! It's fun to feed the trout at the hatchery, learn history along the trail and find the geocaches hidden around the area.
What a place to visit. It's down right gorgeous. Love bringing my family here!

name: Mount Helena
address: Dump Out Trail, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Hiking up to the top of Mount Helena is a perfect afternoon activity regardless of the season. Choose your favorite among several trails that lead up, and take a different one to go down. Enjoy the gorgeous views of the town itself and the surrounding area. Take a break in your busy days, relax and spend some time among hills and forests -- it well worth it!

Great local hike.  The hogback trail is less strenuous and steep. This is actually a nice way to acclimate a bit before you go bigger. I flew in from Texas and this was a first hike before I headed to Glacier!
素晴らしいトレイルです。山頂まで1906トレイルで45分。途中でも山頂からも素晴らしい眺めが待ってます。

name: Parrot Confectionery Store
address: 42 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
As I have said before: a favorite historic haunt for lunch and treats. Lovely environment. Pleasant staff. Today, a Mexican Lime for my sister; a perennial favorite for all of us and one order of handmade vanilla ice cream with a pitcher of housemade hot fudge. Devine. For her,
 Cinnamon fondant mints , and for me, dark chocolate covered ginger pieces for later.
Fantastic chocolates.  Salted milk chocolate Caramels are bomb! So are the hay stacks :) very friendly staff as well.
Cute little candy shop. We always stop here when in Helena to grab a treat. They are super friendly and the candy is great.

Recieved my box of "thin mints" ?...in the mail today, in Mi.  Perfect condition and just as good as I remember...I saw the picture of carmel apples and my mouth actually watered...I remember those too.  We used to bring our preschoolers down for field trips......WONDERFUL place...
It is such a throw back, the chilli is great. The decor with all the sweets is a neat blend.

name: Showdown Montana
address: 2850 US-89, Neihart, MT 59465, USA
reviews: What can I say!?!?! Showdown is a great ski resort for all skill levels. Children and family friendly. At $49 a day, probably the most reasonable price you'll find in Montana for the chair/runs ratio. A weekend favorite for most around central Montana and with the hot spring a few miles away, perfect for any weekend get away. Highly recommend!
Always a blast at Showdown. Super kid friendly.  The staff and instructors are always there to help.
As a younger and quite proficient skier I find it is a very fun place to ski no matter the conditions, especially in the trees! The staff is friendly and very helpful. Anyways no complaints.

I have been coming here for more than a decade. The snow is always fresh, fluffy, and natural. And the mountain is always quiet due to the small crowds. The staff is friendly and the prices are great! Definitely my favorite ski resort in Montana. #showdown #montana #skiing #snowboarding

What a fun place to be. Wife never skied before, so signed her up for lessons. Was wonderful experience.  My first time on  the mountain was AWESOME.  Great friendly and professional staff. FOR A GREAT DAY OF SKIING: Showdown IS the place to be.

name: First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park
address: 342 Ulm Vaughn Rd, Ulm, MT 59485, USA
reviews: The museum itself was extremely neat and clean. It's a small establishment that you can tour yourself - which I LOVED! The 2 guides were helpful and answered any questions that we had regarding the jump. I would absolutely suggest this place to anyone visiting the Great Falls area.

We were spending a few nights in Great Falls on our way to Alaska and had to get some parts at a local RV shop.  Fortunately for us, we missed our exit and had to drive to Ulm to do a legal U-Turn.  As we exit the highway I see the sign to First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park. Interesting name so we decided to visit.  So glad we did; the young receptionist was very helpful and after talking with her and two Park Rangers we decided to tour the facility and site.  What a piece of history we knew nothing about.  Fascinating and then taking the drive to the cliffs I couldn't imagine running ahead of a herd of buffalo and at the last minute jumping over the edge to safety.  This park is definitely worth a visit.  Make the time.

Great history and amazing views of the valley. A great 1 mile hike up to the buffalo jump cliff, or take the road around the other side of you don't want to hike it. Restroom is available in the visitors building and near the cliff.
What a great place to see.  It is so peaceful and tranquil. I enjoyed it so very much.
Always wanted to visit here. Very interesting place with lots of history. Staff was very friendly.

name: Museum of the Rockies
address: 600 W Kagy Blvd, Bozeman, MT 59717, USA
reviews: Such an awesome museum! Would reccomend for all ages! We enjoyed the reptile exhibit the most! The alligator snapping turtle is too cool. Very informative  and you can easily burn a couple hours here.

I love to come here when they open a new exhibit. They always have fascinating exhibits. Their dinosaur selection is a little limited, but this is a good place to take some kids who want to learn a little more about history!

Absolutely impressed with this museum. Great scope of local history and relevance as you're guided through the contribution Montana and neighboring states have made to better understanding previous eras. Lots of western history and places for kids to play. Staff was friendly and prices were fair.

This museum is clearly a national treasure, worth of a few hours if you are in the area.  Particularly, we enjoyed both dinosaur fossil collection and the native Americans collection.  The dinosaur fossil collection is very extensive and informative.  Top of the world research on dinosaurs here as we were told.  The museum stuff and volunteers are very helpful and knowledgeable.  As we missed the regular guided tour, we were given a “short” version of the tour in the dinosaur fossil collection.  Highly recommended!

I hadn't been to the Museum of the Rockies since I was much younger than I am now and, boy, I think i've been missing out.  Simply being surrounded by the knowledge, the history, of our state and the Rocky mountain area as a whole, was such a cool experience.  Don't forget about the super neat dinosaur skeleton stickers in the giftshop!

name: Blackfoot River Brewing Co
address: 66 S Park Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great beers and variety! Finally a brewery that doesn’t make a million IPAs and makes an awesome German beer! Super friendly staff. Look forward to drinking here for years to come.
Great brewery. Loved the beer. Got very busy on a rainy Thursday afternoon. Free popcorn.
Blackfoot brewery has some of the best beer in town. The atmosphere is very intimate and organic. There's almost no way that you can't fall in love with everything here.
A real good place to meet friend's and have a real good beer.
Pretty good IPA’s, but I honestly only go here for the popcorn, and yes, VEGAN.

name: Ten Mile Creek Brewery
address: 48 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Loved the brewery and the beer. Love the location. Great shelf of kids toys and a couple of kids tables. They share the bathroom with their neighbors so it is down a hall. They were adding a beer fridge while we were there. Can't wait to go back.

Excellent brewery! I had an amazing experience having these local brews at Ten Mile Creek Brewery. This is one of Helena's coolest spots. Surprisingly, one of my favorite brews here was the Funky Cold Medina, a sour beer! I also enjoyed a pint of their Oatmeal Stout. If you are new, I would suggest trying out a flight and then choosing your favorite in a pint. The employees are helpful, and provide great customer service. My group asked if we could bring in some pizza from a place down the walking mall, and they did not hesitate to say yes. The staff welcomed this gesture, and I would like to personally thank them for hosting our group and being understanding. Cheers!
A broad selection of well brewed beers, served by a friendly staff, in a nice, open (kid friendly) space.
Great bar tenders. Excellent atmosphere for a brewery. Beer was good. Worth a stop if your in the area. No food at the brewery but plenty of places nearby.
Great brewery right on the walking mall. Big open space with a patio in the front. Pretty good list of beers with 3 different IPA's on tap when we visited.

name: Gallatin History Museum
address: 317 W Main St, Bozeman, MT 59715, USA
reviews: An interesting small local museum in the old county jail. Not expensive to visit and easy parking out front. Lots of jail history exhibits but also lots of pioneer history. A few things kids can touch so great for families. Run by volunteers and self supported. Great bookstore with lots of local history as well as western, cowboy and Yellowstone. They also have Montana cookbooks.
Being from Three Forks, I thought the GHM would be comprised of information I was familiar with. That was not the case by any means! Really interesting content, we enjoyed our time spent here.

Awesome tour guide! Very knowledgeable of the history of Gallatin county and the history of the building the museum is housed in. Amazing artifacts on display! Absolutely intriguing to see the actual jail cells, gallows, and read of the criminal justice activities in the newspapers just as everyone read them over a century ago. Well worth the time and entrance fee, especially since allowed to wander at leisure after the tour. Antique items galore on display!

A great place to learn about some local history of the town.  They have some interactive items that the kids seem to enjoy especially the jail cell.  The staff is very helpful & it's bigger than you would think looking at it from the outside.
Wonderful history! This used to be the jail!

name: American Computer & Robotics Museum
address: 2023 Stadium Dr #1a, Bozeman, MT 59715, USA
reviews: Insanely awesome museum with some incredible computers and things I never would have expected from a museum this size. You could easily spend a couple of hours here. The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, and the computers and artifacts here will blow your mind. If Steve Wozniak has been here twice, you know it's good.

This is a low-key museum in campus-type building but has a lot of amazing stuff. It's worth spending time and unbelievably it is free. If you have time before your flight from Bozeman, I recommend you to drop by here. It is 20 minutes to and from the airport. I definitely want to visit again if I have a chance.

Kind of hard to find, it is surrounded by regular businesses and in the same type of building as the businesses.  And it doesn't have a big sign to let you know where it is until you are right outside it's door looking through the window at a 2X2 sign in the window.   That said once you find the place it is a great museum.   They go back to the precursors to computers and electronics all the way to present time.   They have a lot of first items (1st handheld gps, dna sequencer, consumer PC, etc).   The exhibit on the enigma machine is both big and in depth.   The part on womens role in programming was very interesting also  It is a smaller museum but most people would spend an hour or 2 here.  If you are really interested in computers and robotics they have videos playing and you could easily spend double that time looking around.

This place basically has the history of all technology and how it became and developed I don't know how they got it all but they have everything this is a excellent place to go and excellent Learning Place also I was very very pleased not one to go to museums would go back

Fantastic museum. I never thought a computer museum could be so interesting. The history starts incredibly far back, but covers the most important aspects of computer and electronics history. The collection of old computers and electronics is amazing. I can't believe such famous people donated to the museum. There is tons of stuff from Steve Wazniak and tons of other famous people from the computer and electronics world.

name: Residence Inn by Marriott Helena
address: 2500 E Custer Ave, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: The Helena Residence Inn isn't what it used to be.  When it first opened, the breakfast and evening appetizers were much better than they are today.  I've stayed in several Residence Inns and this one disappoints.  I requested several times, the top floor.  I got stuck on the second floor.  The Best Western Great Northern is still a better hotel overall than the Residence Inn.  If the Best Western had kitchens, I would be there.

Rooms were very nice and had a little kitchenette. Pool was good size but does need some refinishing. Breakfast selection wasn't bad, but a bit lacking given how much the rooms cost. Staff was mostly friendly and accommodating. 
Can't find a company email though and I can't get through to the phone number. Left something in my room just last week that I needed back.

This hotel is right next to the airport. It's newly constructed with a comfortable, laid back atmosphere.  Large well layed out rooms with kitchenettes. They are set up nicely so no need to bring your own dishes and silverware here. Managers are friendly and always willing to help. Breakfast is not served until 6:30AM so early risers will need to fend for themselves.  Large jacuzzi with indoor kiddy splash area and large warm pool.
Nice hotel not too far from Downtown Helena. Not immediately obvious, but it's near several restaurants, groceries, and shops which make it perfect for an extended stay.
Very nice hotel, friendly staff and great location. Newer hotel and love the fireplace suites.

name: Headwaters Heritage Museum
address: Three Forks, MT 59752, USA
reviews: Incredible couple volunteering tonight. Just trying evenings 2 nights a week and hoping people will stop. We were walking by and noticed the open sign. Very knowledgeable! You need to take time to go. I especially loved the upstairs that had little shops set up like stepping back in time.
Great museum with very helpful staff. Lots to see. Very helpful personal.
Well done and interesting. I enjoyed seeing the local artifacts and learning about the area.
Very informative!
Great local heritage and historic representation

name: Barrister Bed & Breakfast
address: 416 N Ewing St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: The Barrister is a beautiful, warm and comfortable place to enjoy Helena.  Every room has its own charm and elegance. We ran into some troubled weather on our way from Portland and Beth was so flexible about our arrival time. We very much enjoyed our time chatting with our host, Nick, learning about the history of the Barrister. Definitely a place to return to. Thank you!

Oh my! What a gem for Helena! Beautiful home, immaculate renovations and restorations. Nick, the owner, did a fantastic job. Tons of character! Beth and the other female were just as wonderful.
