This sets the bar for all B&B's! Breakfast this morning was just amazing! Close to an expensive restaurant in a big city. Nick spent time showing us around, and even chatted with us during breakfast. You can see the three of them are so proud of the home, it beams from them at all times. Great location, close to everything, and views are amazing. Thank you, we WILL be back.

Great 1 night stay!  My husband and I stayed at the Barrister B&B on 8/28 while traveling from Glacier NP to Yellowstone.  We picked a good one!  We stayed in the Morning Room which was adorable and comfortable.  The property is in a great location and we enjoyed walking to the downtown area with many shops and restaurants.  We loved the breakfast - yummy! (thank you, Chris) and mostly enjoyed meeting Nick, Mary and Beth.  We are so glad we chose this property and will definitely stay again if in the area.
A beautiful and comfortable B&B across the street from Helena’s lovely large cathedral only a few minutes drive from the capital building and museum. Wonderful staff make you feel at home.

We spent 2 nights at The Barrister in The Garden room. The room was beautiful with a private bathroom. Offstreet parking was very convenient. Nick and Beth were both readily available to make sure we had anything we needed. The breakfast was fantastic and there were snacks and drinks available 24/7. Great service in a beautiful old world B&B!!!!

name: Paris Gibson Square Museum of Art
address: 1400 1st Ave N, Great Falls, MT 59401, USA
reviews: Rotating exhibits. Small but free. The building itself has such a captivating ambiance. (Its actually my favorite building in all of Great Falls.) Gift shop filled with beautiful handcrafted items. A nice spot to kill a bit of time. They have multiple events and classes throughout the year to check out as well.

The Paris Gibson museum is a great place to visit alone, with friends, or family. A very unique experience for lovers of art and history. My family visited the location, and it was very enjoyable. I highly recommend for anyone looking for a fun time. Admission is FREE to the general public, which makes it an even better experience! Also, if you play Pokemon Go, there are 2 gyms, and 3 PokeStops within the museum parking lot! Plus the nest is constantly changing. Highly recommend!

We went to the Champagne, Chefs, and Art fundraiser hosted at the Paris Gibson Square Museum of Art and we had a delightful time. The Square really dressed up the place and they really did a beautiful job. The lighting, the decor, the set up, it was all just done very well.
Beautiful building with amazing art and classes ! I love the way everything is decorated and clean and inspiring! Lovely people!
A very cool spot. Glad we stopped! Plus it's free!!!

name: Lucca's
address: 56 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
I’ve been here twice since I’ve been in town and have not been disappointed. It is very comparable to other big cities’ Italian restaurant. The staff was very attentive. Their pasta dishes have been very good. The portions are fairly large and they do not skim on the meat/proteins. Everything is very well seasoned too. I also really like their dipping sauce and butter for the bread that they bring out. 

Im looking forward to coming back every time I’m in town.

Personally I just don't see what people get out of Lucca's.  The few times I have been here it has been over priced for what you get and it takes forever to get your food.  The food is good but not amazing to me.  When it costs $25 for a piece of lasagna I would think it would be amazing.  I guess I'm just not cut out for this dining experience but I know a lot of people do enjoy it.  If you have 2 hours to burn this is the place for you.  The staff is great I can say that.  They were all very nice people and very helpful. It just took too long to get your food and in my opinion it wasn't worth the money or the wait.
The food and wine were perfect! Our waitress was so amazing. I recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and wait staff that is amazing. Hard to find in Helena. Way to go guys!
Incredible restaurant. Great experience, fun to visit, and awesome food. Dont miss the Tiramisu!
Very nice romantic feel great for date night definitely recommend the mussels!

name: On Broadway
address: 106 E Broadway St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great food. We showed up at 5:15 on a Thursday and we were seated right away. No children's menu but they provide rolls right away that entertained my kids. Nice cocktails at a reasonable price. They had a Thai peanut chicken appetizer that was really good.

One of our favorite places for date night. They don’t take reservations, so if you are going on a weekend night, don’t be in a hurry if you want to enjoy the experience. Grab a drink at the bar and have a good time while you wait. Food is fantastic and atmosphere is top notch. They make great drinks and have a good wine list. The creamy Parmesan salad dressing is my favorite dressing of all time.

Do you like to have happy times? Happy times are served here. No matter who you are you're likely to feel right at home here with quality food and genuinely kind people. Check out the wine list, check out the salmon, don't over think it. Did you have a terrible day at work? This place washes the patriarchy away. Give it a try, it's worth it

Our evening at On Broadway was the most perfect dining out experience my husband and I have ever enjoyed. These people are Pros! From our hostess who's name we didn't catch to the bar tender (Adam) and our server (Ellie), the entire experience was fantastic. I thoroughly enjoyed watching the Chefs work from my seat upstairs, very well run kitchen. Superb food,, just the whole package!!

Nice atmosphere. There was a live band playing the night that I was there. The band volume was reasonable, we were able to have conversations without shouting. The restaurant was packed, we got there at 5:30 on a Wednesday and had to wait 45 minutes for a table for five. The menu had a good variety of items. Every one at my table was very satisfied with their dinner. We also split some appetizers (artichoke & variety plate) both were very good. We will return.

name: Cafe Zydeco
address: 625 Euclid Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I enjoyed my first meal here! Tried the chicken gumbo and half of the All That Jazz Po' Boy. The sandwich was served at a room-like temperature but was still really good. I also had hushpuppies. I left full. It was all good flavors, nice staff, and a unique decor, so I will definitely be back! ^_^

I had the Catfish Cajun Taco. It was more like a burrito, which is fine with me. Very flavorful food & next time I want a burrito I'll go here. The ladies working there were great. I was happy they offer fried okra.
Interesting and friendly. Had bunches of posters with interesting sayings. Food was good. Everyone there seemed happy and content.

Hands down one of the best lunch places in this town. The food is full of life and flavor. The service is friendly, and the atmosphere is clean. I usually get orders to go from here and I love the way they package my orders with care. I wish they were open for dinner!
They have some great combo meals now. Stop in and check them out. I had the Bayou Po boy and seafood gumbo today. So good!

name: El Vaquero Taqueria
address: 1338 11th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Went here today with some friends who visit a lot. I'd never been nor heard of this establishment until today. The food is absolutely delicious,  and Is served out quickly. This is not a dine in establishment, but the food is made right before your eyes and the taste of homemade Mexican food cannot be beat.

This is a gem in Helena that I recently discovered. I had the carnitas street tacos and they were to die for. I can't wait to try other things on the menu. The only negative I can think of is that there's absolutely no indoor seating and is very crowded inside when ordering during peak lunch time. They do have great outdoor seating if it's nice outside though.
The BEST. My girlfriend and I come from missoula sometimes just to come here. Will never forget our burrito dates.
If it's supposed to be super authentic Mexican food than it was fine. Although even though it was good, it was a bit unflavorful. I don't need to go back....🤷
Great food, good service, and an all-around good atmosphere. I always stop for lunch .

name: Bullman's | Wood Fired Pizza
address: 1130 Helena Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
I liked the experience but it wasn't a 5.5 star experience.
The food was good but the asiago and garlic had no real flavor. The culture and atmosphere was fantastic. But it feels weird that the kitchen and the windows seem like someone installed the building backwards. With that said, the patio looks cozy and quiet due to its location at the back of the building, albeit a bit dirty.

The wait staff and people were great, I'd come back for that alone.

Four stars is kinda generous, but 3 stars is way too little.
This was the best pepperoni pizza I've ever had. Definitely coming back.

All I can say is wow! Best dang pizza ever! Not like pizza hut or those nasty name brand places. I was gold mining last year out there on the Discovery Channel and we all fell in love with this place. Kid friendly all the way.

More and more the pizza has burt bits attached or the crust is scorched. I love wood fired pizza and have eaten it from coast to coast. I think more care needs to happen in the oven. I love their thin crust, their sauce, the balance of cheese with all ingredients. They have some of the best specialty pizzas and you can split a pie for variety; you can build your own. The apple walnut salad with choice of dressing is one of the best in town. Staff was polite and attentive this visit. I do wish the would have some seltzers, Pellegrino and fruit seltzers by bottle or can. NO TV is a marvelous feature.

My first time at Bullman's was amazing. This place knows how to do pizza and they do it well. It's a very cozy 11 table building, but the amount of take out orders they did while we were waiting was crazy. I had the Glacier which has pepperoni, Canadian bacon, bacon, jalapeños, vreen peppers, and pineapple. It was great. I wanted to eat the whole thing but I restrained myself.

On top of the fantastic pizza, the waitresses were also awesome. Super friendly, made sure our drinks were good, and made sure we didn't burn ourselves on our pizzas when they came out. 

We'll be coming back to Helena just for this pizza again.

name: Shellies Country Cafe
address: 3122 US-12, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I got their "Holy cow chicken fried steak" dinner and I 110% understand why they call it that. The plate it came on was the size of the hood of my car. The chicken fried steak was HUGE and came with mashed potatoes and corn as well as chicken & dumpling soup (The soup was also absolutely amazing 'just like mom used to make' )  the meal was easily two meals. It was delicious and I'll definitely return. They also had a large selection of pies and desserts which all looked and sounded amazing. I HIGHLY suggest you check this place out. It's also a truck stop so truckers stop on in. It's more than worth it. Quality+quantity. 11/10

Just plain good food! I ordered tomato soup in a bread bowl, which was obviously homemade with chunks of tomatoes and cream, in a crusty sourdough bun. Hubby loved his burger! The strawberry rhubarb pie with huckleberry ice cream was memorably delicious! Service was friendly and efficient. Price was reasonable. Only 4 stars...? Should probably be five... But the noise level was a bit too high for comfort.

What a gem tucked away in this little town. Had the Friday special tuna sandwich and best clam chowder I ever had. Service was fast and friendly. The place was busy and filled with locals. If you are in the area, I recommend you stop in.

Stopped in for coffee and PIE and Shellies did not disappoint!!💯 The PIE was AMAZING 😍 There was four of us and we all ordered something different (then taste tested them all). We tried the banana cream, the German chocolate, the peanut butter chocolate & the butterscotch. They were BIG 🥧slices too😁 The pies are homemade and they have a huge selection to choose from. I could have taken a piece of each one to go...lol. The coffee was hot fresh and tasty as well!!

Holy Cow!  Seriously, the menu includes the Holy Cow section where portions are as big as yur head and there several pie flavors to choose from...  open 24hrs it's great for earlier mornings and late nights.

name: Mediterranean Grill
address: 42 S Park Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Amazing! Great service, food and wine list!! Went with my dad while visiting Helena.  We had a great time. The food came with tons of vegetables which was a bonus. The salmon was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. The swordfish was also cooked perfect. Nice and tender and not overcooked.  I would come back here again.

I got the lamb chops and matcha tea creme brulee and they were both very yummy! I like my lamb medium, and it was slightly medium rare, but it wasn’t too bad. 

Staff was friendly. Atmosphere is good.

My second time eating food from here was through delivery. I ordered the lamb chop again and it was cooked super rare. I called and the chef spoke to me and after seeing pictures, agreed to remake my order. Soon after, the owner called me to make sure I was satisfied with how it was handled. 
Even after this mistake, I will definitely come here again based on the customer service!!! The food is amazing too!

Very beautiful food. Good beer. More than friendly staff. 

Some of the food I couldn't pronounce but I'm sure it's amazing. 

Would recommend to other people and people who are more cultured than I am. 

Chairs are not American sized. I'm balancing on a single cheek. Worth it.
Wow! Who would have thought that such traditional  Mediterranean food in Helena.  Stuffed grape leaves are as good, or better than being in Greece.
Anyone traveling through Helena should make this a destination, not to be passed by. These folks know how to prepare and present food. Flavors are authentic to their name.

name: Nagoya | Japanese Steakhouse & Sushi
address: 2790 Washington St, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Great take out, i would say the hibachi portions seems slightly more generous if your looking for more. The other Japanese dishes we got tasted perfect. Maybe too much onion on the bottom of the teriyaki chicken, in the take home box on the way home it just really baked that onion on the bottom DEEP into the chicken. The dynamite roll was amazing!  Thank you for picking up the phone right away!! First time trying the restaurant, wished it was in person! Will order again!

I always love this type of place. Good show as always. Everything was cooked perfectly. The dressing on the salad was unique flavor compared to other places. Good veggies. We tried a couple of sushi as well. I loved the veggie one.

It’s a decent spot for Japanese food. It’s quite expensive for an average quality of food, even though they advertised it as “finest and freshest ingredients”, this is plainly not true because the fish were frozen (still tasted frozen in sashimi and nigiris), knowing that’s it’s impossible to get fresh fish such as tuna or oysters around here. A platter of oysters were $10 for four tiny pieces. We also got a chicken teriyaki that came out over cooked and dried, which was very disappointing. Despite this, I understand that it’s not easy to get fresh ingredients here so I still enjoyed my time at Nagoya because I acknowledged that there’s not many Asian restaurants around here. The servers were super friendly and accommodating, but I think the hostess needs to check her attitude because we did not feel welcomed when we entered the restaurant. She didn’t even look at us and immediately said “follow me” without “please or thank you”... and no smiles! Of course I didn’t come here for service, but it would be nice to have a good atmosphere for the dining experience.

The best thing about this restaurant is the side where the chefs provide a stunning show as they prepare our meals on a huge grill in front of us.  Highly skilled chefs.  Food was wonderful.   I found the other side of the restaurant's atmosphere where the tables and booths are less spectacular.

This place is always consistent. The food has so many wonderful flavors! Service is always impressive and attentive. The hibachi grill is a great experience for any age. So unique since we have nothing else like it in Helena.

name: Ristorante Bella Roma
address: 22 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
My girlfriend and I split a four course meal. Overall, I really enjoyed the meal, although there wasn't quite as much to eat as advertised, so the two of us ended up being only mostly full.

The quality of the food was good and the presentation was great. If you're going to split a four course meal and you've got an appetite, of recommend splitting a four course meal and tacking another salad on the side.

Magnificent food,  wonderful cocktails,  professional staff beautiful environment, lovely murals on all the walls,  gentle music.  It would be a fantastic place to bring a very special date,  celebrate an anniversary or treat yourself to high quality 5 star cuisine.  You get a traditional Italian 4 course meal starting at $50 or can pick and choose your  meal selections instead. For all that you get i firmly recommend the 4 course, we found  it's more value for dollar. I also highly recommend the cocktails, they were absolutely perfect.  I did not try the large wine selection yet but i plan to,  the menu also gives food pairing with wine suggestions,  i found that to be helpful if you aren't as familiar with wine like myself.
Delicious, authentic, lots of food! Honestly exceeded my expectations. The waiter was very friendly, prompt, and helpful recommendations.

The place is way overpriced and not accommodating at all. My fiancé loves authentic Italian but I’m more of a simple chicken and pasta type. We went in thinking they would have a bit of a variety, or at least an option for those who don’t like eggs in their spaghetti, but no. Don’t go unless you’re both huge fans of overpriced “authentic” Italian. We ended up leaving right after sitting down.

We enjoyed a delicious four course meal here and loved every bite. The desserts were amazing. The espresso was fabulous. That's a big deal in my book-lots of bad espresso out there. 

They recently enhanced the interior, which is a lovely change from the austere atmosphere of past iterations.

The chef clearly knows food and has a gift for interesting combinations. Helena needed this. And I love it that you can sit outside on a patio away from car traffic. 

Going back immediately.

name: Brewhouse
address: 939 Getchell St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: This was one of my first meals in Helena! They have great beer cheese soup and coconut onion rings! I also enjoyed the IPA I tried. Note: people either love or hate the beer cheese soup but I really liked it.

The Brewhouse is a stop for us every time we come to Helena.  They have a great selection of beers and ciders, food is great (can be a bit pricey though), and the service is always very good.  Waitstaff work well as a team and servers are very attentive.  My favorite is the sweet potato fries and the onion rings as well as the black and blue burger paired with the Miner's Gold.

Great lunch and fast service at the upstairs side. I had a burger with bacon added and it tasted amazing. The meat Patty was slightly too thick to be perfect though. The side salad was good, I was very happy to see no cheese on it. The kids meals were a good size.
Food was well worth it! Mac and cheese and cheese curds are delicious!
The Buffalo chicken sandwich wasn’t bad but the pizza 🍕 was awful. My buddy got the pizza. The beer 🍻 was good tho. 3 stars ⭐️ all the way

name: Windbag Saloon & Grill
address: 19 S Last Chance Gulch St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Historic setting that about a year ago was completely remodeled. Still very genuine and authentic feel AND delicious food. Also good selection of Montana beers. I had the fish and chips which were delicious.. and even better when I spotted the malt vinegar. My lovely bride had the philly burger special and said it too, was delicious. The Windbag remains on the list of top local, (non chain or franchise) eateries.

I've been here a couple times and have been impressed each time! They have a great selection of beers, an awesome atmosphere, and really great food options. Pictured is the pretzel, but the wings were great too. I also love that they have a different special for each day of the week. It is located on a neat car free, walking area in downtown Helena!

We were able to seat ourselves rather quickly. Our waitress arrived with menus and took our drink order. Drinks arrived and placed out order. My salad arrived ask the gal that brought the salad for silverware; my wife asked her if they had sweet and low. She did not know but would ask. She never came back. Finally our waitress showed up. Got silverware, sweet and low. Food arrived from same gal as previous. Ask her if our daughter could get a refill. She said yes, but never returned. Waitress arrived and got refill. 

Recommendation is to have support staff take ownership or work with wait staff to address customer issues or assistance.

Besides that the food was great. I had the Mac n cheese burger, my wife had the BLT and my daughter had the original Mac and cheese. She said it was very good. My burger was still hot after I ate my salad. I thought I may have waited too long. We also ordered the funnel fries. Nice sweet and tasty desert.

We came to Helena for a quick trip & the Windbag was recommend to us. Hands down one of the best restaurants I've been to. Everyone that was working was very friendly & helpful. We loved that there were so many choices. They also had a great kids menu. We love the ambiance of the restuarant & their prices are worth the amount of amazing food you get. They also have a wide variety of specialty drinks & handcrafted beers. Definitely a must if you are in Helena, MT

Had a great experience at Windbag Saloon! The drink specials are quite unbelievable. I had a $5 Moscow mule that was absolutely delicious. Then during happy hour I was informed all pints of draft beer are only $2.50...unheard of. Nick the bartender was very kind and provided excellent service. Would recommend this place to anyone! Thanks

name: Benny's Bistro
address: 108 E 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Benny's Bistro is easily my favorite restaurant in Helena! I go there almost every week and am greeted with smiling faces and exceptional customer service. Every one of the employees do their absolute best to ensure the customer has a wonderful experience and this results in the most pleasant dining experience Helena has to offer! Every item is house made and always blows away my expectations. I applaud Eric, Hillary, Nash, and Zack for making every visit better than the last!

Benny's is the best. Simply put. I've been visiting this establishment since I was young girl. Memories of family gatherings, celebrations, birthdays; etc are all held within those walls..Beside the nostalgia, the service, food, and atmosphere is amazing. Love it here. Love the owners, love it all. 💓 

PS. Best tomato soup in town!

Had lunch there with my mom yesterday. I had the Thai Curry chicken which was good and she had the Montana Rancher sandwich. The sandwich was cold. And not just cold as in a cold cut sandwich, but as if it was pulled out of a cooler and mildly thawed. The bread was nearly frozen, tomatoes and lettuce were frozen and all of that was covered in a lot of mayonnaise. It should not have come out of the kitchen at all. Really disappointed that they served something like that. Doesn’t seem that they take any pride in their meals.
I’ve always had this issue with Benny’s- they’re never consistent with the quality of food they serve. It’s been a while since I’ve been there and I had hoped that changed but clearly it did not.

Always a wonderful experience here at Benny's!
Although, one time they ran out of the Walleye special really early one evening, it still has some of the best & freshest food around.
Great, friendly servers and cool, lite live music adds to the ambiance. 
A must if visiting Helena!

Had the Creole "Brick" Chicken. It was very good. Could have been a little more spicier since it was advertised as having "creole seasoning". Enjoyed the Chocolate Ganache Tart for dessert. Very nice atmosphere. Lovely local place. Will be back for sure!

name: Steve's Cafe
address: 630 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Can anyone say enough great things about this absolutely wonderful restaurant! The menu goes on and on or create your own . So many homemade items you'll be amazed ! Everyone of the staff is always cheerful and they make your experience worth going over and over again ! Don't miss out on stopping at either of their two locations !

OMG THIS PLACE WAS GREAT! I had the pleasure of indulging the taco omelet. The staff was good, the service was....they offered me a cup of coffee while waiting to be seated. Grade A on customer service for that alone. Add that to fact that the waitress was on point,  I'll  be back

Excellent food. We had two littles with us so they put us off to the side. They put a paper under the high chair to make cleaning the floor esaier, which was a great idea. All of us enjoyed the food. Can't wait to come back. They had a infant seat in the bathroom which is great.

I was looking for a local Helena restaurant for breakfast before leaving Montana and happened upon Steve's Cafe. I tried the shrimp omelette with hash browns and berry pancakes. It was a large serving, so i couldn't finish everything. I was not disappointed. Food was delicious. Service was good, staff were friendly, and prices not too high. Great coffee! I really enjoyed the authentic diner ambiance. I would definitely stop again for a good breakfast and try something else. I recommend eating here for breakfast.

Homemade corned beef hash was amazing. Super clean inside, and easy to find the restaurant too. The service was great, all the staff was super polite, super attentive, and very prompt. The food came moments after ordering, really fast service. Everything was cooked perfect, but the ham in my wife's omelette needed to be cut into smaller pieces. That was our only complaint and I'd hate to call it a complaint because our experience was wonderful and we'll always eat breakfast here anytime we're in Helena.

name: Melaque Mexican Restaurant
address: 1827 Prospect Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Tried a combo plate and it was good, better than two of the other places I tried in town. They do have good refried beans and rice, better than most places that serve that sort of side. They have really strong margaritas! I had to wait around a bit after only drinking one before I could drive home. 🤣 the staff were very nice to me as well. Cute decor.

After eating at Fiesta Mexicana the night before, we decided to try Melaque, glad we did as it was great.  Waitstaff worked well as a team, our server was attentive, took our order in a timely manner, made sure chips and salsa were full as well as drinks, and our food was great and served very quickly as well even though the restaurant was completely full (people were actually waiting for tables to open up).  Great job!

Love this place! The food is good can’t really go wrong with anything. I recommend the Melaque Burrito and the tamales. The only negative is that it’s pretty small and can wait for a table for a while sometimes.

Great service and consistent quality! There are very few places in Helena and Montana for good or close to authentic Mexican cuisine, this place is not too bad. Some of the traditional dishes have been adjusted because locals don't necessarily like some dishes, so it has been altered to fit the local tastes which is primarily Caucasian.
Instead of simmering sauce to proper consistency. They do not season and add corn starch.  Despicable.  Never again.  called to confirm the cornstarch. Yep. No effort. Lazy cooks.  Save yourself.

name: Silver Star Steak Company
address: 833 Great Northern Blvd, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great service and fabulous food.  Silver Star makes the best Dirty Martini in town.  Their bar menu is superb.   The muscles are served in a jalapeno butter sauce that is just scrumptious.   My husband is a fan of the lettuce wraps. My daughter loves the calamari.  And the desserts!  The bread pudding is a must and the Tuxedo cake is my favorite.
Their bison burger is delicious! They also have a great cocktail menu and nice staff. I can't wait to go back and have another meal! 😍

We ate dinner in the lounge at happy hour on a monday. We were able to order off the happy hour menu, lounge menu and main dinner menu. We got the steak tips and raviolis off the happy hour menu. They had run out of the potatoes. The steak tips were very salty but the ravioli was great. Also tried onion rings that were really good. I had the steak and lovely mashed potatoes. My husband has the bison burger which was huge. The special happy hour cocktail was a cranberry apple that I enjoyed. Service was really good. Did slow down a bit at the end when they started getting busy.

We just sat at one of the tables in the bar and ordered from the menu there. The food and drinks are great and I was able to order exactly what I wanted. My waitress was extremely professional, kind and friendly. Ther kind you don't get much anymore. I had a good time.

Understated Montana elegance with a superb menu. Seafood, steaks, pasta, and great cocktails; Silver Star is a destination spot to relax and enjoy a delightful dinner with friends. One of Helena's finest establishments, but come casual and fit right in.

name: Bad Betty's Barbecue
address: 812 Front St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great service, awesome food. We went on a Wednesday and got the briket special. Was fairly busy for lunch but still got our food quick. Two meals was enough for two adults and two toddlers.  We were given a couple of fidget spinners that made my toddlers day. Loved the Mac and cheese

Want honest to goodness good smoky barbecue? THIS is the place you're looking for! Though the orders can sometimes be slow coming out of the kitchen, the food is worth the wait. This is among my Top 5 Cue Joints in the U.S. Repeat trips are authorized and encouraged.

Just plain good eatin. You can't mess up slow cooked meat and when presented in a laid back, inviting environment what's not to love? The only problem is their business hours. I almost never get to enjoy this establishment because they're always closed when I try. 🥺

Third time visiting Bad Betty's. Pretty tasty barbeque but it's the slaw and tater salad I really enjoy. Only have two wishes... First, two to three types of BBQ sauce would be awesome. Their sauce is good, but looking for more of a sweet BBQ style (picky what can I say). The second would be tater tots. Being gluten free I can't do their sandwiches but putting BBQ on tots with slaw is an awesome alternative and a great side! 

However, good overall! A place that I recommend to eat at when in Helena.
Awesome BBQ, as usual. This place never disappoints. Good food. Good service. Usually get a seat in 5 min or less. Down to earth good food. I'll be back.

name: MacKenzie River Pizza Co.
address: 1110 Rd Runner St, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Great meal. My husband and toddlers loved the pizza. And I loved the pasta. Nice kids menu. Fast service.

Good service, good food, good quality and nice atmosphere. My only complaint is the chairs, while quaint, they are extremely uncomfortable. Other than that, there's a great menu selection. And everything we ordered came out fast, hot, and tasted great. Reasonable prices.
Take a look at a $12+ Ruben Sandwich that was delivered to me. Where’s the Corned Beef?

We usually get great service and food when ordering to go. The last two times has not gone so well. The first time they made our pizza incorrect. Last night we order 2 sandwiches with a wait time of 30 minutes. There is only one sandwich ready when we come to pick the order up. It has been done awhile as it was soggy and cold by the time we got home. The second sandwich was bbq that wad so watery that the bread was mush. You couldn't even eat the sandwich it was that wet. Neither sandwich was eaten and to top it off, it was no big deal to the staff that the order was not complete in 30 minutes for 2 lousy sandwiches. We wont be back.
The kitchen manager Bryan is awesome!! Love the atmosphere here. The take out is always really good too, the salads and pastas are soooo delicious

name: Taco Del Sol
address: 21 N Last Chance Gulch #103, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Really great service and very nice people. The food was awesome and the price was petty good for what I got. The place was nice and clean no sticky stuff on the floor or tables.
Large burritos and large tacos. Great location to sit and eat or take it with you. Quick service.

This place is absolutely amazing in my opinion best mexican place in Helena. They have amazing food with delicious flavors. I've never been disappointed and they have absolutely amazing vegan and vegetarian options
Nothing bad about the place, but i found the food to be very mediocre. Friendly staff though.
Love their tacos. Get a shrimp taco and a Barbacoa - you can thank me later.

name: Perkins Restaurant & Bakery
address: 1803 Cedar St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I enjoy the atmosphere, staff and of course the food. I was pleased when they served fresh fruit. The breakfast potatoes were just right. The strawberry crepes were delicious.

Our dinner was very tasty! We had excellent service. Our waitress was courteous and attentive without being overbearing which is always appreciated. We were there to celebrate with family for a wedding from that afternoon. We had a variety of foods from breakfast, lunch and dinner items. Everyone was pleased with their food. Steaks were cooked just right, condiments were asked about, and refills were given appropriately. They were nice enough to be ok with the wedding cake we brought in beings that they have many desserts but no cake. Had they had it we would have gotten it from them. They were awesome enough to bring out a pie/cake server along with plates and new forks and napkins. Thank you Perkins! You were awesome!!
Located in the same parking lot of the hotel I'm staying at. You get a discount if you show your room key. Great place to eat at. Fantastic food great prices great for the family

I like Perkins and usually I get the good meal I hoping for~ sadly I've been disappointed but only maybe 2 times...mostly I've been very happy with my order but I doubt I will order the Eggs Benedict again unless they have a new cook, which they most likely do by now...the sauce was wrong...thick, stiff and very little...but no place gets it right 100% of the time...and that certainly hasn't stopped me from going there...my friend and I really enjoy Perkins...the regular menu as well as the senior one...the service is good, the atmosphere too...it's clean, including the ladies room (love that) and the prices are good as well...so I give Perkins 4 stars only because it couldn't give it 4.5...
I have the Meatloaf it was the best I had ever gotten in a restuarant. Staff is excellent.  As usually we always have a great experience.  My go to restaurant. Thank you

name: Pizza Ranch
address: 3200 N Sanders St, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: I'm from out of town,  was pleasantly surprised on how much variety of pizza, chicken and salads and pizza desserts...staff were friendly and helpful! Will definitely come back when I'm in the area again and again. Our grandson love the fun zone. Thank you ❤

Best place to eat in Helena! 

I've been a long time Pizza Ranch fan from the Butte location. For the opening day the service was fantastic, the food was delicious and the prices are extremely good value! I would recommend this to any local foodie! 

They custom order pizza, they deliver, and always have fresh pizza and chicken available!

On 2/12/2020 we stopped in for lunch. Normally the ranch is great. This time the chicken was over cooked and the breast dry. I asked the attendant if they had other breasts. He stated they had just put out fresh chicken which was false. He did say he would check and never came back. Not only was the skin toasted dark brown there was to much oil under it. The salad bar had mushy spinach in it.  This was the first time I had been disappointed. Still quality control is necessary for customers to have a good meal.

Best fried chicken in Helena. Some of the food is better than most restaurants in Helena, but you'll get plenty of of it. Nice staff. If your hungry, this place is for you. I think PR is three steps above fast food.

This establishment is convenient and fun for both adults and children. The large TV screens with video make it so that adults can continue to enjoy their meals while keeping an eye on their playing children in the arcade. They also have large rooms setup that can be reserved for bday parties. They have excellent pizza, and even offer chicken, mashed potatoes, a well stocked salad bar with many options for topping, soup, ice cream machine, and desserts. Affordable, all you can eat, and custom made pizzas to order. My only complaint is I have been here multiple times where they have run low on food items or the bar has been out and refill has been slow, especially on the dessert bar. Staff is always friendly and helpful.

name: R-B Drive-In
address: 932 Helena Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I have been here before and always had great food and service. Tonight I waited 45 minutes then went to tell them after people who arrived after me were getting their food. They had lost my order. The woman who owns it was apologetic and offered to make the food at no charge. I agreed. She brought our food and left. We open the burgers are wrong, and the worst part is the fries and tots were simply not done and dripping in grease. Oh and we had a free fish sandwich thrown in literally burned black on one side.
halibut fish and chips with their sauce...just as good as I remember from my childhood.
Love it. The food was delicious as always and was fast and affordable. Can't wait to go back
Nevermind In'nout... Awesome burgers.
Great staff, and the burgers I remember from years ago!

name: Nosh Cafe
address: 105 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great food. I really enjoyed the chicken and waffles.  My husband got a waffle as well that he enjoyed. Got the toddler the biscuit which was yummy. I could just eat a basketful of them. I would love to see some smaller portions options for the kids but the food was fresh and great.

I've eaten at Nosh more times than I care to admit this last year! I've never had a bad dish, but the BLT Waffle, Egg-in-a-hole and Chicken and Waffles are my favorites. Whatever you do, ASK FOR GREEN GODDESS DRESSING with/on it. It's the best dressing I've ever tasted... I could literally eat it by the spoonful.
Phenomenal food! Wish I was staying longer so I could eat here every day. Had the egg in a hole and the flavors were amazing.

Very yummy food. Good atmosphere and location. Also super affordable! I enjoy how they have healthy options but also comfort food. I only wish they had acai bowls and espresso and this place would be perfect!!

I have enjoyed the food here quite a bit.  But after the last few visits, I'm not as excited to go. 
-Needs to be detail cleaned, badly.  Dusting isn't an issue, until it blows on a guests food.  The entire store needs some serious love.  
-Smiling :) We had a young highschool girl work there for a few weeks, and it was amazing what she brought to the atmosphere.  I would encourage a better effort to show the guests a positive response - not that I'm an inconvenience for coming back 😣 which is the general vibe I get.
- and dear LORD!!! Move the ironing table with the sides!!! Me and damn near everyone else trips on that blasted table!!!!

name: Planet Gyros
address: 1421 11th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: So I just stopped cause I was hungry. Unfortunately they were out of soup so I was disappointed and was gonna leave but decided to order the original Gyro. It was good and satisfied my hunger. The staff was friendly and helpful. I recommend eating there.  It fit my standard--cheap and reliable...sure wish they had some soup...

Great Gyros, Best in Helena! Had to give four stars because I was running late and called in my order, when I arrived they were not busy and had not started my order making me even later.  I will be back because they do have great Gyros!
We love this place.  Always delicious food.  Definitely once of our favorite lunch spots in Helena!  They are fast too which is awesome!
I've tried several gyros places around the states, and they always leave me missing Planet Gyros. Planet Gyros has the best gyros! 👁️❤️🌎🥙
Friendly service...greeted as soon as we entered. Super quick to have the food ready and out to the table, and it was delicious as usual!

name: LaPa Grill
address: 32 W 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I used to love this place because of the fresh ingredients. The ingredients are still great, but the last 3 times they have gotten my order wrong. Mind you, this was ordered as is from their menu, no substitutions. Once the order was to stay, so it was no problem getting the correct one. The staff was great about making a new one. The 2 times I took it home & it would have been a pain taking it back to the restaurant. This last wrong order was nothing like what I ordered, it actually was the worst burrito I've ever had. I would probably only go back for chips and salsa. Their hot salsa is really good. Their beer selection is also really good.

Good food. Typical American Mexican food. We tried the chips, tacos and burritos. You definitely get the most flavor and most food with the burritos. Nice quick lunch. Nice selection of beer to have as well as a few games to play. Nice place to sit and hang out for awhile.

Wonderful local fast casual food. They have a bunch of options on the menu or you can make your own. Salads, bowls, burritos and tacos that are all easy to customize. The service was great and everything was tasty.

The food tasted good and the staff was friendly. I asked for black beans and was given pinto beans and wanted guacamole but it was brown :( I would try again because my family really enjoys eating here!
I had the nachos and they were delicious! Love the atmosphere and vibe. The artwork is phenomenal!

name: Toi's Thai
address: 423 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I ordered the Pad Nar and waited 45 minutes before leaving. I was the only customer in the restaurant when I ordered, and the watched new customers served their appetizers before I even got a water refill. I have had great Thai food here before, but the poor the reviews about the new ownership must be true. If you can order to go, and can spare an hour, then this is a great choice. But the waiter, and his fedora, were overwhelmed by 5pm on a Friday.

Great food. We came in for lunch right at noon. Only one person working so he cooked and waited on us. He did great. Lots of food. My kids loved the plain kids noodles. I did feel that all the food had the same base including the pad Thai which made it taste different than normal. Still good just different.
I love this place hey Sam it’s me kk love y’all we y’all soon can’t wait to see you guys and eat some spring rolls

Called at 545 for a pickup order of 2 items, they said to come in at 630. I sat from 630-7 waiting for my food, fairly certain they forgot until I came in. The Tom kha gai soup was excellent! But the veggie pad Thai had zero flavor... Ended up chucking half of it. Super disappointing all around, other than the tasty soup.
This little place has come along way. Curries are great but the Thai Spaghetti is my families FAV! Always worth the wait!

name: The Montana Club
address: 24 W 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Christine our server was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! she went over and beyond to make sure we had the full experience. She is very knowledgeable on the history! The food was amazing we even had dessert. We will def be back! (Pricing was right on point)

Very cool old historical location.  Great place to grab a drink after work.  The Bourbon selection is fantastic!  While you are there stay and have some appetizers or a full meal.  Very quiet and comfortable.
The Rathskeller is amazing! The main dining bar is so freaking cool. Nearest place to have a drink in Helena.

Food, especially the vegetarian fare was excellent. Chanteuse usually brings us in to listen.
Large elegant room surrounded by windows where we could watch snow falling was very pleasing.
Awesome

name: Suki Café
address: 15 W 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
I haven't been to this place since they opened. We decided to try them again since we forgot about the place. The food is really delicious and clean. The staff are very friendly and always made sure we had enough water/beer throughput our experience here. 

I would have given them 5 stars but because my wife and I got our orders at different times and our appetizer came after we were done eating. We also had to wait 15+ minutes to get our bill. The restaurant wasn't very busy either. Ultimately, the food is absolutely delicious and inexpensive! I would recommend if you give them a few more minutes. Wish I had photos of the food but I ate them too fast!

Great meal. We did the all you can eat sushi dinner for $30 each person. It includes all the sushi and most of the appetizers and a few other items like noodles. We had two toddlers with us that ate for free. Changing table in the restroom.
Good sushi - for Montana. It isn’t a coastal sushi joint but definitely one of the better places you will find in the treasure state. Nice environment and VERY friendly staff.
Such good food, and great hospitality. Girl there remembers us every time and is the sweetest lady. Such a fun environment. Hands down my favorite restaurant in Helena.

In my honest opinion,  best sushi around. My wife and I drove down from the Hi-Line to eat here. The Suki's in Great Falls is temporarily closed until they find a new location. We are eagerly awaiting for them to find location and open. Our #1 place to eat.

name: Bridge Pizza
address: 70 S Park Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Great pizza place. $3-3.50 for a slice of pizza which is a quarter of the 16 inch one. Happy hour you get free beer with purchase. Small outside sitting area or inside seating as well.
I tried the pesto bread sticks and two kinds of pizza, and you guys knocked it out of the park!  World-class eatery, everyone.  Check em out!
A great business with a friendly and helpful staff! You can always expect good service here.

Great place! The pizza is reasonably priced and tastes GREAT the staff know their stuff and are friendly and fast! Have a busy and stressful day at work? Relax here or take the pizza and make the night that much better. 10/10

You cant go wrong with Bridge Pizza.  Their salads are spectacular and easily a meal by themselves.  We like to stop in and order a "slice;" which is a quarter of a pizza.  Different slice selections each day.  Best pizza in Helena.  And they deliver.

name: Steve's Cafe
address: 1225 E Custer Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: This is a very good mom and pop dinner. Cute and friendly. I had their Ruben and it was delicious. Their homemade sausages were good too. I preferred the chipotle and Italian over the chicken apple one. I would love to come back and get their meatball sandwich when I get a chance!!

Great service, huge portions, and great food. The Marion Berry pancakes tasted great, and the jam that came with it was amazing on some toast.

I can eat a lot, but I couldn't finish my food. Two moderate eaters may be able to split the Chicken Fried Steak meal.

Coffee could have been better; I expect a place called a cafe to have decent coffee but it's the same meager stuff you get at any breakfast place.
Amazing stuffed huckleberry French toast! Awesome sausage and eggs were perfect! Make a stop you will enjoy it.

Helena, Montana.
When I was messing around in Helena, I asked the four locals that were available "What is the best breakfast place in this town?"

All four men replied with Steve's Cafe.

It was a no-brainer to head to cafe de esteban to be nourished for the following day's massive activities.

The host, waiter, and staff were awesome. Montana's hospitality is second to no other state (unlike Nebraska at rank 48 and that's cause I haven't been to two states yet).

I did not try coffee here (had my own french press with the hotel).
However, the ice cold water was refreshing.

Food is standard diner food. It wasn't as OG as Waffle Plus in Spokane (sorry to compare) however beats the heck out of 90% Cali diner food.

Veggie ommie - decent sized. It has olives so make sure to omit.
The avocados not too shabby.

Pancakes - Smaller than anticipated. Had nice thickness and not too dry. Tasted more commercialized (pre-made pancake batter) than a house recipe.

Frenchie Toast - Standard size. Yummy. This was bomb with the crisp strawberries on top. The s-berry mix was sweet enough that it didn't need syrup. Plus the powdered sugar made it sweet too.

Hash Browns - Commercialized. Came from a bag. Ya can taste it. They do give a good amount.

Overall I loved the place. Can't compare it to any other local flare.

Pricing - Appx $10 per head which is expensive for Montana. But that's what happens when you win a bunch of awards.
@cigarcpa
Always a must stop when I'm in Helena.  Staff is always attentive and friendly. Love the Corn beef hash, but their pancakes and French toast are equally AWESOME!

name: Jade Garden
address: 3128 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews:
The server was very nice. But the food was expensive, the seafood in the seafood dishes we ordered wasn't visible, and there were things (more than 1) floating in my water. But the absolute worst part was when I went to use the restroom, it was beyond FILTHY! Smelled horrible, and the feminine hygiene disposal was OVERFLOWING (a large part of the gag inducing smell, I'm sure)! When I told the woman  at the hostess station, who was one of the owners according to my server, she got really rude with me;almost confrontational. As if I alone was responsible for the bathrooms being in such a state. I told her she ought to be ashamed, and if the front of the house looks like that, I'd hate to see what their kitchen looks like. We'll never go back. 

We'll spend out money at The Chinese Kitchen on Euclid. Where there actually shrimp in the shrimp fried rice, and customers are treated like humans.

This restaurant definitely is the rich, deeply flavored version of Chinese food. The egg flower soul is one of my favorite soup of all time. The almond butter chicken sauce is guilty pleasure to the max. The Canton noodles have wonderful flavor but I don't love the quality of chicken they use in the dish. This is one of my favorite Helena restaurants and I love visiting it when we are in town!

A nice Chinese restaurant in Helena. Is quality Chinese food with large portions and very reasonably priced. This place has a knowledgeable and friendly staff. Great place to get lunch or dinner and has room for a decent group of people.

The best Chinese restaurant in the region! We ordered Kung Pao Tofu, with steamed tofu (rather than fried), and Sesame Tofu. Food was served quickly and it was fresh and delicious, with large, family style portions. We left with a full second meal each! The menu offers a great variety, including beer and wine--a good wine list, even though the server did not quite know how to serve it. Our server was efficient and pleasant. The atmosphere is upscale and neat as a pin. Wish there was a Jade Garden in my town!

I really enjoy Jade Garden. It's kind of expensive but worth the extra money on a special occasion. However, we placed a to go order & it was an hour late & we didn't get the whole order. I'm really disappointed. Probably won't go there again.

name: Murry's
address: 438 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Passing through town and stopped at Murry’s to meet up with friends for brunch. Mick helped us and was incredibly helpful and kind to us during our visit! She helped us with food suggestions, which we all took! We had some yummy spicy potato quiche they just made for the first time today. Very welcoming environment
The service and the food were really good!! I got the Hashbrown Waffle and it was absolutely delicious!

Overhyped. My palette was all set based on people raving about this place. The food was good but unfortunately it was underwhelming. This is not intended to bash this establishment by any means. The ambiance and atmosphere was great. The food descriptions were a little short so it was hard to be wowed by the choices before tasting. The apple sauce had the apple skins in them :) kudos for that!

I was rather disappointed. Food in the display case all looked really good, the flavors of the quiches sounded tasty. I was rather excited to try the quiche, my husband ordered a hash brown waffle. My quiche was put in the microwave before my husband had ordered and his waffle took a standard of 13 minutes to cook. Not only was my quiche(obviously) unevenly heated but the crust texture was gummy and not entirely appealing. I think it would have been much better to be reheated at a low temp in a small toaster oven, especially since my food was ready long before my husbands.

beautiful little arts shop
Perfect for clay sculpture and pottery!

name: Hokkaido Ramen and Izakaya
address: 825 Great Northern Blvd, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I was a big fan of the Fusion Grille when it was at this location, so was super bummed when it went out of business. Not anymore. Absolutely love this restaurant! You won't find food like this anywhere else in Montana. I've never been to Japan, so I can't speak to its authenticity, only its quality, which is excellent. I've enjoyed every dish I've tried here, and will definitely be back often. And hats off to the staff, who are always friendly and helpful, and wear the coolest t-shirts!
Lovely restaurant. Friendly attentive staff. Wonderful food. I had the vegetable roll and the vegetarian ramen with a lovely glass of sake. So good. I'd come back every day if I could.
Pretty authentic ramen with good noodles. Not what you would expect in Montana. Pretty good sushi and other food as well. Service has always been good. One of my favorite places to eat in Helena.

The staff really cares and it shows. They are among the friendliest and kindest I have ever seen! They are quick to fix mistakes and apologize, many times they have gone above and beyond to ensure satisfaction. I have been here many times and have not had one thing on the menu that I have not liked or enjoyed. If I could give more stars I would! Love this restaurant!

A unique restaurant in the capital of MT. Great Asian foods and drinks. The Ramen is their specialtie that will surprise you. It is well prepared with various flavors of your choosing. If don't like Ramen and want to try something new they have a  great menu that will please everyone in your group. The restaurant is beautifully designed to enhance your experience. A grear place to go with a bunch of friends.

name: Suds Hut
address: 2701 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Waited 20 minutes for a table then ten more to order drinks. Party of 5 gave up and left to eat somewhere else. Too bad, the food is great. Possibly the best burger in Helena. Famous fried chicken. Good beer selection. Get here early if you don't like a long wait at popular times.

Can’t beat this place. Such a great Montana feel. Of course their chicken is great, but the burgers are the best in Helena. Prices are very reasonable for the quality of food you get. Sometimes there can be a wait if you have a party of more than 2, but it’s rarely longer than 15-20 mins. Well worth the wait.

Good chicken place. Kids menu. My kids had the Mac and cheese wedges. One loved them, one hated them. I had the chicken and JoJo's. Very good JoJo. Chicken was pretty good too. Got pretty busy around noon when we were leaving.

I finally went here! Heard about it for years now and have been seeing their food posts on Facebook! They lived up to everything I have been told and have seen. Service was great, drinks were cold, and food was top notch. My only complaint would be, it was uncomfortably hot inside there. However, the open pit fire was neat! I enjoyed the stained glass up and around the ceiling.
Sud's hut has the best wings I've ever had. The atmosphere is awesome, and the beer seems especially good! I don't think I've eaten at the same restaurant so many times. It's THAT good.

name: Smokejumper Station
address: 2850 Mercer Loop, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: LOVE this restaurant! We've driven out for lunch here several times now. Great bar, even better food! Being gluten intolerant I have missed having spicy chicken sandwiches, and the Smokejumper Station has the PERFECT gluten free spicy crispy chicken sandwich! Home fries are delicious and menu options also tasty. If you're traveling into Helena, grab a bite. One of Helena's better food options is right here at the airport.
Cozy lil place with a view! Good music, food, drink. Steak n veggie soup is fantastic! Bloody mary is also great!

They would not honor the discount from MTN Deals an ad they did on TV, very sad.  The wait was long to get our food, and they were not sorry, just gave us food and left.  Overpriced for bland tasting food and meh service. I guess if your waiting for a plane you are trapped and have no choice.  Homeless shelter would have better food and service.
Amazing place to drink a beer and eat some great food!

Mediocrity at it's best.  Sunday is buffet only and it costs a whopping $15.20 which is slightly above average for most buffets.  When you factor in dirty plates, buffet items running out twice within 15 minutes with not a packed house; I'm left with the impression that I'm not getting top service for the top dollar they demand here.  Chicken enchiladas tasted decent with good flavors but looked unrecognizable.  The Mac and cheese was a grease pit with blandness flavors.  The bacon was great and the mini pancakes were decent.  Amazingly there were no eggs available in the is breakfast and lunch buffet.  Interesting enough, they had a massive table blocking the fire exit.  I expected a slightly elevated service and dining experience here, unfortunately I left unimpressed leaving with a price tag that doesn't reflect what I received in exchange.

name: Fiesta Mexicana
address: 3425 US-12 E, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Terrible service. Terrible food. Went there with my wife last night-just 2 of us. Restaurant was only about half full which means about six tables full. Had to wait 15 minutes for drinks and waitress brought wrong drinks. Then had to wait an hour and 20 minutes for our meals and one of two was not what we ordered. Didn't have another hour and a half to wait for the correct meal so tried to choke down part of what was served. Waitress didn't apologize or discount meal.   Don't go there if you want decent Mexican food served in a timely manner.

Terrible service. Took 5 minutes for waitress to acknowledge me at door waiting to be seated. Order was received wrong. Only time waitress interacted with me was to throw (literally threw) the check on the table.

First and foremost, the food is delicious. The atmosphere is great with the music playing in the background. The staff was very friendly and did very well about checking up on everyone. A great experience all around.

The service was so poor and lacking it was ridiculous.  The waitstaff have no understanding of the concept of teamwork, service was slow, the server forgot to pick up our order and deliver it to the table, and the restaurant wasn't even 1/4 full.  When I went to pay the bill, our server asked who our server was... seriously?  There were only 4 tables with people and their were 2 servers.  Servers were not very friendly or attentive.  For a place that advertises on television so much, you would expect that once they get customers in, the service would be decent at least (or perhaps that is why they need to advertise so much - because once people go there, they don't return?.  If you are even considering this restaurant, try Melaque instead.
The food was pretty good. The tortilla soup was very tasty. I would recommend it for a Helena, Montana Mexican food experience

name: Steffano's U-Bake Pizza and Sub Shoppe
address: 2100 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
Instructed to cook 10 to 15 minutes. "For a crispier crust, remove from pan for final 1-2 minutes and bake directly on the rack".

One pizza had a burnt bottom. The other was perfectly cooked... around the edge. The rest fell through the oven rack. 

It would have been less messy to throw $25 directly into the trash.
This place is rock-solid for almost 40 years. Great food at excellent prices! I'll be back.
Love this place! I've been coming to Steffano's since the early 90s and their quality and customer service has been consistently great. Love the pizza roll ups!
Amazing food and service. Had a  wonderful atmosphere and great vibe!
I love their soup and breadsticks! Everyone friendly and fast service

name: MRH Eatery, Mountain Ranch House
address: 625 Barney St, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Stopped in for the first time today and loved it. We had a free slice of pepperoni pizza for the anniversary celebration which we really enjoyed. I got the BLT which had amazing bacon on it. It came with your choice of chip flabors. And the bread sticks which were also good. We will definitely be stopping again to try a full pizza.
Best pizza in Helena. The dough is fresh, some of the meat is cured in house which is so cool, and it’s clear the food is made with love.

We had the Brisket BBQ pizza today and it was delicious. The brisket was just delicious. First time in here as we just moved back. Staff is super friendly and the menu is attractive. We will  be back for sure!
The food was awesome! But the tweaked out blonde waitress took it upon herself to give herself a $30 tip on our credit card after we'd tipped her in cash.
Amazing switch of ownership, chef and waitstaff. Worth it!! Homemade ravioli, calzone, lasagna, spaghetti and meatballs, and pizza.

name: Hwy 55 Burgers Shakes & Fries
address: 2530 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Let's face it, you're craving a cheeseburger right now.  If you weren't, you wouldn't be reading reviews of burger joints.  Hwy 55 is THE burger cravers burger joint.  With style and substance, the cheerful folks here will leave you satisfied.  Juicy burgers, salty tots, and oh so sweet milk shakes all made to order.  Give 'em a call and swing on by, you won't be disappointed.

The food was amazing. The bacon cheeseburger was delicious. The meat was juicy and very well cooked and The cheese was the perfect kind of melty goodness it needed to be. I ordered a milkshake and definitely wasn't disappointed. The server was so helpful and very nice, she made me very welcome and comfortable. My order didnt take too long to come out and everything was so fresh and yummy. The decor is my freaking favorite. Super cute and very retro 50's chic. Definitely wouldn't mind being a regular there while in town for a bit.
Great burger and chicken. My kids loved the car the kids meal came in. Fast service.  God shake
Shrimp Po sandwich was very sub par. (Looked like they didn’t devein the shrimp.) I’ve had a BLT also in the past which I didn’t enjoy at all. Burgers are alright.. shakes are good.

Cute decor!  So many fun things in the restaurant and that's where it stops. The service is horrible and food was a disappointment.  They serve subpar food.  We asked the waitress if the fries were fresh cut, she said yes.  They are frozen fries not fresh cut. I needed gluten free so I ordered without a bun.  The hamburger patty was thin and tiny.  I expected an amazing burger joint and got McDonald's quality.  We will never eat here again.

name: The Rib Shack
address: 2800 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: I pulled up in my truck today hungry as all get up. I said I'm really hungry and I'm a heavy duty beauty and I want brisket. He said he feeds hungry people all day and pointed me to the brisket platter. Doubting it would be enough, I asked what the next largest size was. He said he solves hunger problems all the time. I'm glad I trusted him. Excellent brisket, excellent portion. Very happy customer!

Great ribs. However, they routinely use their bare hands to grab your ribs and put them in the carton. No sink in the trailer, no gloves, no tongs, but bare hands. Kind if disgusting since you have no idea how dirty their hands are. Especially now.

Had an amazing take out meal here. The meat was well cooked and smoked. There was more than enough and the owner was the kindest person I have seen serving food. The pork was a little dry and tasteless but everything else was so good it didn’t even matter. The sides even hit the spot. And the cost was reasonable. This is somewhere we will go back to time and time again. Thank you!

The owner does a nice job with his BBQ.  My family tries to eat at his place every time we are in Helena.  Love the brisket and BBQ sauce.  Large portions and a reasonable price.  I would highly recommend.
My fav bbq in Helena

name: Staggering Ox
address: 400 Euclid Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Had to wait 40 minutes for an order I placed on location. And the poor gal up front got no help at all and had to go get my food after I went up to find out what was taking so long. Food is good, but they need more workers and need to get the food out more quickly.

Pretty good collection of Colorado growlers on the wall. Most are Montana of course, but I was glad to see some familiar logos. Nice venue for parties, too. I'm a bit sad I wasn't able to try one of their rather unique food items though.

I will admit, slightly above normal sandwich prices, Until, I received my meal...
Obviously freshly baked 🍞, fresh ingredients, unique ambience to boot  
Interesting  yet pleasantly surprised...
Then I wandered to the back area and discovered a comfortable music venue & coffee shop...
But WAIT, THERE'S MORE!!!
Not originally from Montana, I found TREASURE, REAL FRENCH PASTRIES & Classic cinnamon rolls, so Cool!!!!
I was told the variety of pastries vary and are all Great...
Give it a try, unique employees and art
Good food. Kids loved the peanut butter and jelly. Very large place. Lots of high chairs and tables. Very orginal sandwich in a roll.
Sandwiches and atmosphere were awesome! Service was not. No one in line and it took almost 15 minutes to make our 3 sandwiches.

name: Godfather's Pizza
address: 2216 N Montana Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Some of the best pizza in town. Not as good as it was in the 80s, but still tasty and they have lunch buffets and dinner buffets on certain days. All you can eat pizza and salad bar.
Pizza was great.  Salad bar was minimal. National website said they offered gluten free pizza.  They do not at this location.  Customer service was ok.  Not great but not horrible.
salad was empty. hot items were cold.  other hot items too hot so were rock hard!  friendly staff but poor service.
The Super Taco pizza is the best pizza I’ve ever had in my life. Please don’t ever close!
One of the best Godfathers I've been to. Clean, friendly, and good food.

name: La Casa Fiesta
address: 632 Euclid Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: A great little Mexican restaurant out of the way and no sign showing where it's at! But good Mexican food! Huge taco salads! Nice waitress:)

The staff is really friendly here was pretty good service. The prices are pretty expensive for the amount of food you get. Chips and salsa were average at best not the biggest fan. Personally not a big fan of their red sauce they put on their enchiladas and the rice is not great to say the least. The restaurant is really tiny. I could see it possibly as a good date spot.
BEST BURRITOS EVER, MY siblings call them spicy beans and they want them every day!
Like the new location. Food was great as always and arrived quickly.  Service was excellent.  It was very busy with all tables full but you could talk and visit without raising your voice.
Always so freakin tasty!  Hope the new location helps them gain some recognition in Helena.  The absolute best salsa so I buy a couple pints to take home too.

name: Last Chance Casino
address: 1001 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Enthusiastic service and good food.  Good portions at a fair price.  Bathrooms aren't spotless but are fairly clean.  Minus 1 star for product consistency issue on the BLT sandwich(still a good sandwich) Not a deal breaker we will be back.

The food here is decent and the service was prompt. The Live Keno here is a great attraction as there is only one other spot for that here in Helena. I liked the beer selection and the amount of gambling machines available. This was a nice visit for a beer or two in a very casual setting.

It is always a hit or miss here for food and gambling. Food for the most part is amazing if you get what you ordered. 😏 Gambling...most of the time you have to ask for refills on your drinks. The restaurant side is different. I have had wonderful staff there...however food still comes out wrong even though the bill is what I ordered.

Sometimes a great meal can get you to in the box sure smashed allot of bosses on the way to get here me and this chew guy crushed it thanks for the chance . Always a next meal never a last one with you guys. You should let me and Jim put your next floor in
Amazing burgers! Nice place to escape the cold on a snowy night!

name: Village Inn Pizza
address: 1830 Prospect Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Love this place.  Pizza is amazing, the workers there are always awesome.  My favorite pizza place in town,  plus if you put in an order you can throw a 20$ in a machine and enjoy a nice beverage while they make your order.  Recomend highly.

They used to have one in Missoula. It closed many years ago. Very sad.
I road trip to Helena at least twice a year for this pie. Not the best in the world...but damn good! And it brings back fond memories!
Really solid pizza. Always our families first choice.  Great crust. Tasty sauce.  Great service. Very reasonable prices.
Unsatisfying and basic pizza. Marina also tastes unpleasant and overly tangy. Just a bland affair through and through.

Maybe the best value lunch in Helena. Village Inn AYCE Pizza & Salad lunch buffet includes a bottomless Pepsi fountain drink or Iced tea..... Fast, friendly, fresh and cheap, what more can you ask of a work day lunch in Helena, MT. Monday thru Friday, lunch time only.

name: Shellie's Country Cafe WEST
address: 908 Euclid Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: You can't beat the Holy Cow meals! Food is great and take home the leftovers.  Have never had a bad experience here.  Great place for pie!!
Nothing fancy, just good food.  Nice selection of entres, and extra large portions available if you need to feed the bear.
The food is FANTASTIC.   Great staff to boot.  Thanks for a great experience.
Fabulous spot. Relaxing and inviting. Great staff and the grub is spot on!
Good basic cafe fare, reasonably priced. Also a full service bar. Friendly service.

name: Motherlode Casino and Diner
address: 1420 Cedar St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: The chicken fried steak is as big as your head! We love eating here. Better portions than alot of others in town.
Love the tomato soup. I go here every Tuesday because I work right next to here hehe
Good food,  but the hash browns were under done.  Restraunt has outdated decor. Great customer service!
Rest his soul and I guarantee he's turning. Love you Taco. Gone downhill after his passing rude service no greating as you enter. Disappointed...
I've always liked going here for the breakfast and the atmosphere. It's a laid back bar and I have enjoyed it every time I've visited.

name: Montana Nugget Casino
address: 612 Euclid Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: You get a lot for your money in the restaurant. Burgers a pasta dish, fried chicken and even prime rib. Restaurant a bar and about 15 slot machines. Bar is small and squeezed in among the slot machines. Feels like a inexpensive, middle of the week date night spot for Gen X'ers and older.
Food is always good minus burgers. We have been sick off of every burger. Machine runners are amazing minus one. We try and avoid those nights.
Excellent food! Fun friendly atmosphere and the casino games are always fun! This our date night treat yo self location of choice!!

Been coming here since I was a child. Loved it then, love it now! Everyone's so nice and helpful, food is great except one time we found a hair in my boyfriend's food... which was a little off putting but other than that it's a great place
I love getting a late weekend breakfast here. Highlight of my week!

name: Dairy Queen Grill & Chill
address: 1700 Prospect Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Locally owned fast food with desserts! Great for the family. A clean place with lots of seating, and more than a few dessert choices ! Service is good, even when the lines are long, which does happen. Be warned, if there is a kids sporting event in town, 15 mins after its over, it will get busy here, but they will get to you as quickly as they can.
Ok for "fan" / fast food.  They do make your stuff after order for the most part.  One of the better options for FF in Helena.

No stars! We just went through the drive through and ordered lunch... the burger was ice cold like they were using previously grilled meat that had been refrigerated and the fries were hard as rocks. They were more like chips. We won't be back. We contemplated calling but didn't want to fight with anyone. There was no one else in the place so not sure why they can't just do a decent job. What a waste of 15 dollars as the food went on the garbage.
This is one of the best Diary Queens I have ever been to!! The bathroom was SO CLEAN, the staff were very friend, and the food was great. I will definitely be coming back!
This place has always been a little slow hence the 4 stars, but the food has always been good. The orders have been accurate, food hot or cold appropriately and the staff friendly.

name: Neveah's Cafe
address: 1431 11th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Wow. Floored. I was looking for some delicious Mexican food and I saw this places and decided to try it. Unreal! First off the owner is the most friendly, positive person I met that day and he lifted my spirits! The taco special was huge and fresh.
Amazing I will definitely be eating here again best tacos in town hands down
Amazing restaurant with an awesome owner. Great food for a great price
Louie is the kindest person you'll ever meet serving the best food I've ever had. If you get the chance, strike up a conversation with him. You won't regret it.

I ordered the two crispy tacos. 

Now. I love tacos. Like, really love them. If I had to pick on food where I could only eat that food for the rest of my life, it would be tacos. If someone ever asks me "Pizza or tacos?" I'd take tacos every time. No amount of money would be enough to get me to stop eating tacos.

I've eaten tacos of all kinds from all sorts of places. The two tacos I received at Neveah's were the absolute, hands down, best tacos I've ever had.

I mean, the people that work there were really nice, but I feel like I got the deal of a lifetime on these tacos. I could die tonight, and be ok with it, because those tacos were so fantastic.

You would be doing yourself a disservice by passing up an opportunity to eat at Neveah's.

name: Subway
address: Pad D, 3048 N Sanders St Suite A, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews:
I have visited this place on 18Dec2019 night.
The sub is tasty and good. Fresh bread.
I am happy with the service and tasty food.
Super clean, fast, fun and friendly. Best Subway I've ever been to... And that's saying a lot.
Great food. Always friendly and speedy service. Recommend highly 👍

The food is pretty consistent. The big thing is customer service. The people helping you can vary anywhere from awesome to horrific. Anywhere from extremely fast to really slow. But I would say 75% of the time I get a really good employee who knows what they're doing and will give me a well made sandwich with clean service providing. I recommend to those people who are on the town chilling with a friend and you want something to eat real quick. Good stuff.
Better staff. Good sandwich.

name: Dive Bakery Cafe
address: 1609 11th Ave A, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: The employees are really nice & friendly. The peasant rolls & vegetables are always fresh. The coffee is also good- not bitter or burnt.
Fantastique! Our favorite was the flourentine sandwich on sausage cheddar peasant roll. If I lived here they'd be seeing a lot more of me!
Best crepes in town! Their sandwiches (breakfast and lunch) and excessively delicious too. (Please open on Saturdays!!!)
Love this place! The quiche is my favorite and am never disappointed with their coffee.
ONE OF THE BEST OR CLOSE TO IT, CARAMEL ROLL I HAVE EVER HAD. WILL DEFINENTLY BE MAKING REGULAR VISITS FROM NOW ON.

name: Costco Food Court
address: 2195 E Custer Ave, Helena, MT 59602, USA
reviews: Good for a thrifty quick bite. Good variety, fast and hits the spot.

Good cheap food. Great staff. The chicken ceasar salad is delicious and good size for $4. The hot dog's are just like you get at the ball park, and comes with a drink for only $1.50.  The pizza is really good and they have 3 options. Pepperoni, all meat, and combination. Would recommend to anyone wanting a quick cheap meal.
Gotta have a Costco dog every so often.
Consistent hot dogs and slices. Cheapest lunch in town.
Eat there almost everyday for lunch, great deals great food.

name: Pita Pit
address: 101 E 6th Ave, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Fast, friendly and tasty. Offers gluten free wraps for a little extra. Vegetarian options also available. Wheel chair accessible. Parking is downtown street availability or pay-lot parking around the block.
Pita Pit is the bee's knees! 🐝 🐝 good food, fast. 😎👍 Pitas > sandwiches 😉 lots of healthy options, thanks Pita Pit!!
The manager is a really cool guy. His staff is nice and the food is good. I recommend the Gyro pita.
Decent food, but limited menu. Lacking pride in there quality of food.
Four stars for a pita pit. Food was good, fast, friendly. Not remarkably clean but decent. Not at all busy at 1:30. New pita menu is an upgrade.

name: Brewhouse Downstairs
address: 939 Getchell St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Come to Helena often and this was our first time at the Brewhouse and WE WILL be back!! Great food and service with local beers. Freeking fantastic 👍🤩🤩🤩

name: Los Cazadores
address: 3000 Canyon Ferry Rd, East Helena, MT 59635, USA
reviews: Los Cazadores is a great place to eat a cheap lunch or dinner. The smothered burrito is all I ever order. A complete meal in one burrito. The red sauce has amazing flavor. The chips and salsa are wonderful as well. Very clean eating area and the kitchen as well. Service is always great with great attitudes.
🍽Pleasant combination of casual and sit down dining. Good table service. Large portions. Fair prices. Strong flavor! Unassuming but rewarding dinner spot. Could only use more 🌶hot sauces 😉🌮🌯

First time there. Service was outstanding. I had the Grilled Chicken Super Burrito. Best burrito I've had in 25 years and I could barely finish it. Happy anniversary. Here's to 21 more years of great food

Los Caz is always great food.  The portions are generous and the quality is awesome. The wait staff is very helpful and keeps things moving.  Their signature burritos are to die for.  Better bring a big appetite though as they are not for the faint if heart.  They are always consistent on quality and I have never left here hungry.  The home made salsa is amazing as well.  If you are in the area at lunch time this is a must try place.  Make sure to check their days though as sometimes they are closed.  Keep up the good work and great food guys.

Excellent food loved their fish tacos! Place is clean and very friendly. The waitress was wonderful! Received food quickly. Very laid back and had coloring books and Legos for my little one. Will definitely go again.

name: Wassweiler Dinner House and Pub
address: 4528 W, US-12, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Meal was great... only thing I would comment is that my entree side was more delicious than the entree itself. Compliments to our server Sam she was great and engaging, would come back often however travel distance might limit the number of visits!

The most amazing place we've ever been,  the amount of love the owner has compelling! The food is so good you don't want to finish because it's truly that good! The atmosphere is classy , relaxing, and welcoming! Boy if you have not gone you truly are missing a piece of heaven I highly recommend Wasseweiler's!!!!
Outstanding food! Great atmosphere! Very expensive. House was built in the 1800s. You feel you are back in time of the 1800s. Great service! Wonderful wine and beer menu.

The food was amazing! The bruschetta was the best! The carrot gnocchi and salmon will be high on our list to have again soon! The venue is cozy and perfect for a romantic dinner!! Great way to welcome the New year!!
Fantastic!  Best meal I’ve had in quite a while.

name: Wing Street
address: Helena, MT 59602, USA

name: The Gold Bar and The Western
address: 406 N Last Chance Gulch, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Very clean and friendly, positive and upbeat environment and friendly and professional service. My fiance and I went there tonight to have a couple of White Russians which were delicious and enjoyable. We also gambled there and won a little money and had a great time.
This is the coolest batender ever. Will keep my service here!!
Miss Sandy's got the tastiest cheap breakfast/lunch deals around and David makes the BEST bloody mary in town!!!! Had SO much fun at the Former Felon's Ball on Saturday night!
Great friends to meet there every time I go in.
Best place downtown

name: Eat Greekish
address: W Main St, Helena, MT 59601, USA
reviews: Eat Greekish food is so full of flavor! I love the menu and all the options they offer. Each of my family members can find something they love. We especially love that they add fries to the sandwiches! Such a fun touch. The staff is fun and so friendly too. Love the bright look of the trailer too, it can't be missed! Thanks for serving Helena Eat Greekish!
